review.reviewBody: I had been so happy with my Hoka shoes, especially the Arahi 6. They wear out fast but my feet were in heaven. Now Hoka has changed the arahi to the 7 and they aren't the same. They feel cheap and are uncomfortable.
review.name: Changed arahi

review.reviewBody: Helps with plantar fasciitis and Achilles tendinitis discomfort.
review.name: So comfortable I bought a second pair.

review.reviewBody: It truly is a stability shoe. Very comfortable for my medium-width pronating feet, and the toe box is comfortable but not excessively wide.
review.name: I love this shoe!

review.reviewBody: My doctor recommended "Hoka" for my hip and foot pain. I was skeptical.... I never spend that much on myself for shoes - I picked out the white Arahi7 and sent the link to my doctor before purchase, he approved, I purchased. My ankle/Achilles pain is so much better. I love the fact that I could purchase white ! I would recommend this shoe to everyone ! I have also got several compliments on the shoe itself, the color and the look.
review.name: First time buyer

review.reviewBody: Use it for walking. Lightweight fits snuggly around the ankle for extra support. Like the rounder toe box.
review.name: Would definitely buy these sneakers again.

review.reviewBody: The color was lighter than it looked online but these sneakers are amazing. You do need to break them in but it's like walking on air.
review.name: Amazing

review.reviewBody: I have worn these shoes in the 6's and that were the most comfortable shoe. I got the new 7's and they are horrible. Narrow and hard like a rock. They kill my feet. I was so disappointed when I got my shoes.
review.name: Uncomfortable

review.reviewBody: These are definitely not as cushiony as I prefer. It took several wears for them to be comfortable, and even then I'm not thrilled.
review.name: Not comfortable

review.reviewBody: I've been faithfully wearing Hokas for years. I went to buy new running shoes and was shocked at the difference in the new Arahi. The toe bed of the 7 is significantly more narrow and for someone who needs a wider toe bed it is not comfortable. I need to find a replacement shoe :-(
review.name: So Disappointed

review.reviewBody: I am very pleased with the quality of these shoes. My shifts are typically pretty long and involve thousands of steps e every day. As someone with flat feet I've been desperate to find something that's reliable without having to mess with insoles anymore. These provide the kind of support I need while being lightweight and durable.
review.name: Solid choice for flat feet and long hours

name: Arahi 7 Wide Running Shoe - Women's

This is my go-to brand for mountain bike shorts and l/s t's.  The same pant style I buy in the shorts doesn't quite translate into a good fit. I'm 5'5" and the pants were too long.  Pull them up and pull in the waistband and that didn't look good, at all.  I tried the Medium; small or large would be too small or too big.
I do recommend the brand!
review.name: Love Norrona

review.reviewBody: I am a bit disapppointed as the description for this cap specifically stated that the bill was "slightly" curved, it was not!  It was totally flat!  And since I have expended effort to curve the bill, I don't think it's returnable.  A real bummer!
review.name: False Advertising!

review.reviewBody: I'm a female with a 22.5" head circumference, and the M/L one size was big on meboth around my head (I had to tighten the back strap a lot), but also the depth; the cap rubs uncomfortably on the tops of my ears and hits the tops of my sunglasses. While this cap is super lightweight, it just doesn't work for smaller heads. I'd love to see it offered in a smaller size. Id also love to see more earthy feminine colors (ex: mauve) that arent too girly like pink/purple.
review.name: Not the best for smaller heads

review.reviewBody:
I have 2 versions of this hat. The first time I purchased (a number of years ago), I thought is was the best cap
I ever owned. Light and well ventilated and fit me perfectly. A couple of years later, I bought my second 
cap, however the new cap size is too large for my head (sits on the top of my ears). Very disappointed with
the change and wish companywould make a Small/Med sized cap.
review.name: Too large - please make smaller size.

review.reviewBody: I love how lightweight and breathable it is, but the strap on the back is not very sturdy. It is the correct fit for my head, but I personally like to tighten my hats during hikes. The strap always loosens on its own.
review.name: Nice but back strap is an issue

review.reviewBody: Love this hat! Easily adjusts without being "fiddly." Washes up well & dries quickly. We have been traveling by RV for the padt 6 months & this hat has become a reliable friend - Seriously a little embarrassed at how often I wear it. Im ordering it in black to give my little blue one a break. It is the right weight, can hanfle being cinched down in the wind without making your head hurt. So light I forget Im wearing it. .
review.name: Best Hat Ever!

review.reviewBody: Such a great cap. I love the way you adjust it. This is the best I have ever had.  Tighten and/or loosen without having to take the hat off. Thank you for finally coming up with a good way to adjust this hat. Material is great also. Light weigh so its not hot.  I will be ordering more
review.name: Love this hat

review.reviewBody: I love the way this hat fits.  It's super comfortable.  It has some style to it too!
review.name: Aerial Cap

review.reviewBody: Adjustable band slips, needs constant adjustment.  I sweat and wash my hats regularly.  When I washed this hat the sweat stains were still visible.  My OR and Tilley hats wash nicely.  I definitely would not buy this again, actually I wish I had not bought this one.  Size runs large; when hat is adjusted down the shape is changed and and has a more crumpled look.
review.name: Not for regular outdoor wear.

review.reviewBody: This hat comes down a little farther in my big head than the OR swift caps
review.name: Need more available colors such as yellow and gree

review.reviewBody: I like this cap, it replaces the Impulse cap I lost.  I wished the  Impulse cap would return too.
review.name: New cap

review.reviewBody: These are great boots. They look rad, feel high quality and keep my feeties toasty and protected for winter work and outdoor activities. As others said though, they run really small. I'm normally an 8, ordered a 9 and they fit perfectly. Glad I sized up.
review.name: Quality boots, run small

review.reviewBody: Huge fan of Vans shoes. I was very excited to try their hiking boots. They run narrow and small compared to the shoes. So buy 1-2 sizes bigger. Other than that they are perfect. My feet have been warm, dry and comfortable on my recent hikes.
review.name: Warm and comfortable

review.reviewBody: Got mine in today and went half a size up per review recommendation. If you bought previous MTEs and like how they fit go up one full size if you buy these. MTEs break in very nicely and last a long time if you take care of them.
review.name: Definitely go up 1 full size

review.reviewBody:
I always wear size 10 in Adidas shoes and so I ordered a size 11 because of the earlier review I read on the product.  The size 11 was way too big for me.  I called Backcounty and they were so quick in making the exchange for a size 10.5 and that was still too big a size. So I called Backcounty and they sent me the size 10 that I should have ordered from the very beginning.  Size 10 fits my size 10 foot very good. 
I needed this shoe for work and Backcounty made sure that I was well-taken care of in this process of getting the right size I needed.  Thank you!
Every customer service rep was gracious and very quick in helping me.
review.name: Good fit and good look

review.reviewBody: I normally wear a size 9.5 Mens in Vans Old Skool Comfy Cush. I had heard that when ordering these MTE boots, I needed to order a 1/2 to 1 size larger, so I ordered a 10.5. Turns out that the 10.5 is too small. Make sure of your size before ordering, because Backcountry.com charges $6.99 to return them. Pretty disappointed in the experience.
review.name: Sizing is not the same as Vans Old Skool

name: Ultrarange Exo Hi MTE-2 Shoe

review.reviewBody: I did a fair amount of research before purchasing this rack.  My biggest complaint about 1Up and other similar racks was the lack of a proper lock.  This has an outstanding lock that would cost over $100 if purchased separately.  The rack is easy to operate and looks amazing.  Branding visuals are minimal.  I've used it with road and mountain bikes, and it works equally well with both.  Highly recommend!
review.name: Excellent Rack

review.reviewBody:
Pros: doesn't touch carbon frame. It locks onto tires.  Carbon is extremely vulnerable to rubbing so a rack that grips frame will not damage carbon on long drives. Outstanding at locking bike in place.  Tilt functions are awesome.  Has feature that prevents rack from moving around in hitch.  Works great. I really like this rack. I bought it because a bike company executive (who has deals with all the rack companies) stated it works great with carbon bikes.  My son has owned this rack for years and loves it as well.
Cons: extremely heavy and bulky. 
Overall: I really like this rack particularly for carbon-frame bikes. If I didn't have carbon, I might consider others just because of the weight.
review.name: excellent rack for carbon bikes

review.reviewBody: No wobble with the pin setup, and super easy to put on, fold up etc. The included chain is super overkill too
review.name: Perfect fit and built like a tank

review.reviewBody:
Before penning down this review, I had the opportunity to use this rack about four times. Having experienced various other types of racks, I can confidently say that this one stands out. Not only is it quick and easy to securely mount your bike, but it also boasts the best aesthetics among its competitors. The rack is predominantly metal, with plastic only used for the notches that secure the arms in the lock position on the bike.
Ive been using it with my 48-pound Specialize Levo comp electric full suspension. While theres a bit of wobble when driving over bumps with the bike mounted on the rack, it seems to be a normal occurrence given that the arms holding the bike in place are positioned over the tires.
The rack comes with a fairly heavy chain, but the latch it attaches to feels somewhat flimsy. Its sufficient to deter a casual passerby, but a seasoned thief might not be so easily dissuaded.
Highly recommended,
review.name: So far so good

review.reviewBody: A little background, I purchased this rack after having enough with my T2. My friends have kuat racks but I couldn't bring myself to buy their piston pro at that price point. I think this rack is pretty great, its well built and assembly is intuitive and easy. Its far superior in operation than the T2, it moves from stowed position to load position fairly smooth, however I cannot award five stars since its operation isn't as smooth as kuat racks I've used but way better than the T2. It's definitely wider than other racks but my bikes typically hang off one side of the car anyways so its not a big deal but something to note if you have a really small car. the ratcheting system seems solid and I like how clean the security is. I'm not a huge fan of cables so the fact that they include a chain is a big plus. I think this rack is a good balance between quality and price point. I went with this style since the typical arm style rubs into my fork and that was frustrating, not to mention anytime I tried to get into my hatch with my T2 it was annoying.
review.name: Its a great rack!

name: GuideRail 2-Bike Hitch Rack

review.reviewBody: I love everything about this bag! Fits my needs as an art teacher. My only concern that I didnt think about if how to clean it if it gets dirty. I would not want to wet the leather details.
review.name: Beautiful

review.reviewBody: I love this bag, perfect for a small laptop and a book or two or just the size for a day trip. Great quality and the color is fantastic .  I love this company, eco friendly and responsible.
review.name: Great bag

review.reviewBody: I had thus bag for a few years and just got better looking as it gets old. The worn out look makes it like an old reliable fried.
review.name: Love my bag!

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love the quality and build of the very durable backpack. Im 6 tall and have a large chest and my only regret is not getting a larger size. This backpack looks very small on my back.
review.name: Great quality

review.reviewBody: I use it all the time its a great backpack for stuff it fits my computer and all my belongings

Style-check.  Function-pretty much.  You're not going to want to load this up with books for a day on campus or a hydration bladder for a day on the trail.  But as a purse substitute for essentials and a puffy jacket and nalgene--does all that with aplomb.  Wife loves it and style-matches the mini kankens our kiddos have.  Color seemed a little off from what is pictured but that can likely be a 'monitor' or 'photography' anomaly vs dye lot.
review.name: the look and color she wanted...

review.reviewBody: She loves this bag! There isnt anything the Orche color doesnt go with and it works for everyday use with ease! Amazing quality backpack!
review.name: Birthday Gift for Mom

review.reviewBody: I love this bag! An excellent size, perfect for a small laptop and a book or two or just the size for a day trip. Great quality and the color is super cute. Above all I love this company, eco friendly and responsible. Will buy from this company again for sure!
review.name: Love this bag!

review.reviewBody: I gave my wife the Kanken No. 2 and she uses it everyday. It is a great product. Very functional and stylish.
review.name: Great Product!

review.reviewBody: I love this backpack. Its a beautiful color and i love the leather. the size is good for school work. a little small and is better for non-heavy work but totally amazing for traveling and for aesthetic pictures. Its super cute and you guys should definitely get it.
review.name: Love It

name: Kanken No.2 16L Backpack

review.reviewBody: Pretty good amount of use already...dig em! For future reference I'd prolly size up at least a half, if not a full size, but they do seem to be stretching out a lil. They seem to be holding up well so far, but again...they are snug, so we'll see. Otherwise very comfortable though!
review.name: Great so far!

review.reviewBody: I would highly recommend this shoe to anyone. However, I am giving four stars because of how cheap the insoles are. The shoe itself is state of the art, but the insole is very cheap. Its a thin piece of foam. If you have overpronation/flat feet, you WILL need to buy new insoles. I bought new insoles and these shoes are the perfect walking/travel shoe. I can walk all day with these for sightseeing, light hiking, etc.
review.name: Extremely well builtexcept for insoles

review.reviewBody: my husband loves these shoes and is on his feet a lot and says they are worth all the hype
review.name: so comfy

review.reviewBody: Have now had 8 pairs of these. Very comfortable!!
review.name: Great Shoes

review.reviewBody: Super comfortable. Like walking on clouds. I have 2 pairs.
review.name: Very comfy

review.itemreviewed: Steens Mountain Full-Zip 2.0 Fleece Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Cozy jacket with a balanced amount of warmth that lets it be great indoors or in warmer conditions. Only suggestion to improve would be a chest pocket with a zipper. Dont know why that isnt already a part of this since the quarter zip version has that.

review.itemreviewed: Steens Mountain Full-Zip 2.0 Fleece Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a great jacket if you are out into outdoor activities or honestly just casual wear. Its very lightweight but the fleece does a great job at breaking the wind and keeping you warm. 10 out of 10 jacket.
review.name: Best Jacket Around

review.itemreviewed: Steens Mountain Full-Zip 2.0 Fleece Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have worn the Steens Mountain Fleece jacket for years! Its my favorite jacket out of the many I own. If you are on the fence or wondering if you should purchase do it. Its light weight but with it being fleece does the job at keeping you warm. I recently lost mine that I had for almost 10 years and didnt hesitate to order a new one immediately.
review.name: Best Jacket Around!!

name: Steens Mountain Full-Zip 2.0 Fleece Jacket - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Falketind Flex1 Heavy Duty Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: Recently, I started to wander away from other companies because the lack of quality for the price. I've wanted to try Norrona for sometime and so I decided this would be a good start. I wanted something that I could wear often to really figure out if Norrona was worth the premium. They have great stretch, but don't feel soft. They are high waisted in the back and are easily adjustable. The full leg zip feature took some time getting used to but I really, really like it now. Im used to wearing half or three quarter zip pants with the only function of dumping heat. These use a full zip to dump heat halfway, then expand the pant leg for base layers and open the cuff for larger boots. I even tried the breathability of these pants on a 45min Peloton Ride and never got hot or overly sweaty. These really are a great do everything pant, with the exception of colder, wetter conditions. Thats why Goretex is around. Ive only had these pants for a couple weeks, but they have exceeded my expectations. My only grip is the zipper/crotch area could be bit looser so I can pull the pants up higher. I plan to use these for mountain hunting and light mountaineering along with the Norrona Svalbard HD pants this coming spring, summer and fall. For now, Ill use them to work out in and ski tour warm days. If you want the best in breathability and rugged materials, this is it! Im getting rid of the rest of my outdoor pants for Norrona!
review.name: This is the outdoor pant you want...

name: Falketind Flex1 Heavy Duty Pant - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Frontier UL Two Pot 14-Piece Multi-Cook Set - 4 Person
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Ohh my goodness let me say I was so excited when I received this product in the mail because me and my family love going camping so this was perfect for us. They withstood a hot fire so very durable, really easy to clean, all in all I am very satisfied with the product and I highly recommend it. Thank you so much influenster.
review.name: Very durable camping gear

review.itemreviewed: Frontier UL Two Pot 14-Piece Multi-Cook Set - 4 Person
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a nice setpractical, compact, sturdy, and convenient! These were really handy to have and eliminated the need for extra junk while camping.
review.name: Nice!

review.itemreviewed: Frontier UL Two Pot 14-Piece Multi-Cook Set - 4 Person
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Absolutely wonderful products. Took on a long camping trip and was absolutely perfect.  Easy clean up. Heated evenly, storage was a breeze. Definitely will be using these again.
review.name: Sweet and simple Camping cookware

review.itemreviewed: Frontier UL Two Pot 14-Piece Multi-Cook Set - 4 Person
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This little cook set is made very well. We definitely will be bringing it along with us for some camping sessions this summer. I like that there are enough pieces to cook different parts of your meal. I love the finish and colors of this set. Very cute, like glamping!
review.name: Glamping ready!

review.itemreviewed: Frontier UL Two Pot 14-Piece Multi-Cook Set - 4 Person
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is such a great set that fits all together perfect for traveling. The utensils snap together & are decent sized for adults & children to use. I love that it includes a microfiber type of cloth to protect the pots from moving around. The material is very durable and will hold heat very well. Highly recommend for those looking for a set that comes with a bit of everything
review.name: Nice starter set

review.itemreviewed: Frontier UL Two Pot 14-Piece Multi-Cook Set - 4 Person
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Im planning to go camping and I need these two pots. I like how you can put them in each other and save so much space. Also this set includes plates and forks and spoons.
review.name: So helpful for camping

review.itemreviewed: Frontier UL Two Pot 14-Piece Multi-Cook Set - 4 Person
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] If you are a regular camper of even just the occasional camper, this two pot cooker with dish ware is perfect to add to your camping supplies. Everything stores inside of each other for convenience turning 14 pieces into one easy to carry pot. The pots have handles that lock and unlock for added safety. Its also really light weight. The silverware and bowls are a silicon material and the  pots are anodized aluminum. Which in my opinion is the reason I gave it 4 out of 5 stars. I know they use aluminum because its light weight but Ive read before its not the safest  to cook out of. I believe anodizing it makes it safer but I do prefer metal pans typically. I do still recommend because we only go camping a couple times a year and dont think its harmful if you dont use for your everyday cooking. This would also be easy to pack along for a backpack trip and you could always choose of just bring the smaller of the two pots if you really needed to conserve space. Really happy to add this to our camping collection and cant wait to see how the food turns out.
review.name: Nesting pots

review.itemreviewed: Frontier UL Two Pot 14-Piece Multi-Cook Set - 4 Person
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This camping utensils are amazing in a single pot I have another small pot, four bowls, pack of utensils and the amazing handles for the pots that help hold them as well as lock it as well. Its amazing and I would carry it everywhere.
review.name: The best camping utensils

name: Frontier UL Two Pot 14-Piece Multi-Cook Set - 4 Person

review.reviewBody:
I wanted to return the pants and it was impossible to figure out how to return items.
Your company needs to do much much better. 
Ill never shop with you again due to Too Difficult To Return. 
I hate to be negative, but with online shopping, Easy Returns are a Must.  Just include an invoice with return directions, for heavens sake.
review.name: Could Not Return - Wont Shop Here
comment: We are very sorry the return process we do offer online has not worked out for you.  We have emailed your return information and if you need any assistance please call or chat with our customer service team.

review.reviewBody: Beginner skier. First time buying skiing gear. I chose HH because all of the ski instructors and my friends who ski swear by HH. Quality I am sure is great. I bought a HH Alpha LifaLoft Jacket XL that I will keep. The pants feel great they are just too slim for my body shape. I wear a 34x34 in Levi 531s. Around the thighs and groin were extremely tight although my waist had a few inches of free space. I was unable to sit or bend in these pants.
review.name: Slim Fit

review.reviewBody: I have two of these HH Legendary pants; black and red. The pants drape nicely with a soft hand, yet are quite windproof and highly resistant to moisture penetration. I've worn one or the other pair in the New England and Montana regions of the US, and Austrian Alps; skiing the piste, woods, and back country. Great product at a great price!
review.name: Excellent quality and soft drape

review.reviewBody:
Good pant for warmth and dryness. A bit snug.  Definite skier look. Will use for mild to warmer days. Would recommend a belt.  Great ventilation. 

5'6" 183 lbs Male.  Stocky build.  25 years snowboarding in 0-45 degree weather with a decent tolerance to cold. Base layers are Costco cool 32 degrees.
review.name: Does the job.

review.reviewBody: These ski pants are super lightweight warm and comfy the fit is perfect
review.name: Amazing pants

review.reviewBody: These are fantastic ski pants.
review.name: Great

review.reviewBody:
I expected a lot more from Helly Hansen.  These don't have most of the features you will find in a lot cheaper pants from other companies. I am sorry I bought them The only reason I am not returning them is they are a color match to a Helly Hansen jacket I bought. Not only are they cheaply made but they run a little small as well. 

I would not recommend these pants
review.name: very cheaply made

review.reviewBody: Nice simple ski pants, run small.  Quite tight on the thighs.
review.name: Nice simple ski pants, run small

review.reviewBody: The pants I received appeared used. I returned them and backcountry would not give me a cash refund because they believe I was the one that used them. I feel this is very unfair for me. Backcountry did not check the inventory before shipping it and the consumer has to suffer the because of their carelessness.
review.name: The pants received were used

review.reviewBody: These pants are comfortable and lightweight. Even in snowy conditions with warm underpants they are fluid and comfortable. I recommend these pants. We bought them for a Christmas gift for our son at his request. He is enjoying them and these are his comments.
review.name: Lightweight ski pant

name: Legendary Insulated Pant - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Ghost Max 2 Wide Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Ran the Chicago Marathon in these shoes and they were perfect! Maybe it was the adrenaline but my feet felt like I was running on clouds. They provided the perfect amount of support especially given my high foot arch. Bought the Pelican color and receive many compliments when I wear them. I am a Brooks fanatic for life!
review.name: Very impressed!

review.itemreviewed: Ghost Max 2 Wide Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Was very excited to try these as I loved the original Ghost Max ,you added colors to the wide width so I didnt have to chose from only white or black
To my disappointment they are much more snug across the toe box, my big toe was numb after wearing, I even tried a mens wide to see if that helped and the same problem persists
They are comfortable for my plantar fasciitis so I guess Ill try the extra wide but super disappointed I have to get black or white
review.name: To snug in toe box

review.itemreviewed: Ghost Max 2 Wide Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love them so much. They take the sting off a long run. Lots of cushion and equal amounts of spring. Also, best looking running shoe Ive ever owned. Win win win.
review.name: Good Vibes

review.itemreviewed: Ghost Max 2 Wide Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I really wanted to love these!!! It had everything I wanted the rocker action, the cushioning and the color, I LOVE bright loud running shoes but after several 5Ks on both track and treadmill these feel so heavy and make me feel like I am pulling my legs along by the end of my runs. Was hoping to make these my race shoes for my HM next year. 
I was running in adrenalines prior to this and loved them but after logging 300+ miles on those I wanted something with more cushioning.
Might have to try the Hyperion Max 2 since those are a lighter shoe.

review.itemreviewed: Ghost Max 2 Wide Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Unable to review as will be returning due to being too tight width wise in toe box

review.itemreviewed: Ghost Max 2 Wide Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Im so sad that these are not as good as the first version of this shoe. My main issue is the toe box is so much smaller than v1. Feels fine under foot, I just need more room.
review.name: Much more snug in the toe box than first version

review.itemreviewed: Ghost Max 2 Wide Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Overall they are okay. They take a while to break in because they are so stiff. They are stiff & hard compared to the original ghost maxs. The original Ghost Max was perfect, offered perfect amount of cushion & so extremely comfortable! Brooks took away a great product, I miss the original Ghost Max. But the Ghost Max 2 is just okay.
review.name: Bring back the original Ghost Max!!

review.itemreviewed: Ghost Max 2 Wide Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I got these as a gift because I raved about the Ghost Max shoes I had, so far they were the only shoes I could ever wear without hurting my feet. I got the Ghost Max 2 for Christmas and tried to wear them around the house and my feet were numb because they were so tight across the top of my feet. I had so much trouble finding a pair of shoes I could wear to teach in and Im so discouraged because I have to start over trying to find a new shoe.
review.name: So disappointed

review.itemreviewed: Ghost Max 2 Wide Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: They are my favorite par of shoes yet! I prefer them to the first version of this shoe. They made a lot of good improvements!
review.name: Loved them

review.itemreviewed: Ghost Max 2 Wide Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love these shoes just had foot surgery and they were the most comfortable shoes that I wore. I am on my feet at work all night. They fit perfectly and are well worth the price.
review.name: Love it

name: Ghost Max 2 Wide Running Shoe - Women's

description: Buy the Snow Peak Aluminum Tarp Pole online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Aluminum Tarp Pole
hasVariant.description: Buy the Snow Peak Aluminum Tarp Pole online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Aluminum Tarp Pole
hasVariant.description: Buy the Snow Peak Aluminum Tarp Pole online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This SP aluminum tarp pole is lightweight and is the most solid tarp pole that I have ever used.  I have a number of tarp poles, and portico/canopy poles, some of which are SP and some of which are from other manufacturers.  The other tarp poles I have are steel construction, are thinner, around the same weight, and have more 'play' in them (play meaning that there is a small gap at the connection points which allows the pole to move a bit back and forth within the connection joint).  These have almost no play.  Also, these do not have any rust near the joints either, though I have not had them in the rain yet so time will tell, I don't expect it to show signs of rust like the steel poles that I have.  One of the SP steel tarp pole sets that I own has a "rubber band" that holds all the sections together when they are taken apart.  This is good because it keeps all the sections of the poles together, but also means 1) can't 'mix-and-match' pole sections to make different lengths of tarp pole depending on the situation, and 2) when the camp fire gets to close to the pole, which can sometimes happen depending on the application, I worry about the rubber melting or breaking, though not sure that would be any big loss as the general function of the tarp poles should still last even without the rubber band 'tether'.  This SP aluminum tarp pole does not have the rubber tether, so can be mix and matched with other similar SP aluminum tarp poles to make 140 cm, 210cm, or 280cm tarp pole(s).  This means that a bag of different of these tarp poles can be used for several different SP tarp set-ups and configurations.  I currently use these poles to support a SP Land Station L and SP Takibi Tarp Octa and this has worked flawlessly.  Because of not having a tether, instead these have a push-button "lock" system to keep the poles held together.  The push-button lock mechanisms are very smooth and the sections go together easily and flawlessly and then they come apart easily and flawlessly and are comfortable to put together and take apart without needing to wear gloves, unless its cold outside then I wear gloves because the poles get very cold as can be expected because they are solid aluminum.  Also I am not sure that the locking mechanism is 'necessary' once the poles are set up -- I do see that the locks are necessary for during the set-up process so that once a pole is locked together it can be carried without worrying about any of the sections falling off by accident.  Also should mention that the rubber bottom stopper "foot" at the base of the pole and the top pointed "tip" where the tarp and other accessories attach is much more quality and durable than my other tarp poles, also the tip part is longer than other tarp pole tip parts and it had diamond bezeling to help keep the tarp, accessories, and ropes in place once fully set-up, so far I've noticed that during set-up this is convenient because it helps to keep the tarp, accessories, and ropes more in place than other tarp poles with shorter and smoother tip parts.
review.name: More Solid Than Any Other Tarp Pole

name: Aluminum Tarp Pole

description: Buy the Cotopaxi Bataan Del Dia 3L Fanny Pack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Bataan Del Dia 3L Fanny Pack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Cotopaxi Bataan Del Dia 3L Fanny Pack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Bought for my sister-in-law who is using it in their camping trip to quickly stow epi-pens and other small necessities when they hike the state park trails. She also loves the bright colors and the up-cycled fabric. Could use another zip pocket on the front of the main compartment.
review.name: Great for short hikes with the family

review.reviewBody: I've only recently joined the Cotopaxi family, but really like your products and mission. Keep up the good work of doing good for society.
review.name: COLORFUL AND PRATICAL

review.reviewBody:
This year I made Cotopaxi my Go To Gift!
Besides gifting myself 1 ;). I made 7 other people very, unexpectedly happy! So many reasons to be proud to both give, and/or receive a Cotopaxi product! Thanks for being apart of 2024

I ordered this for travel as a personal item and it is the perfect size for my passport, license, phone, and lip gloss! (The essentials). I used it just today for a drive and hike and I had what I needed right there w me.
review.name: Perfect size

review.reviewBody: I have been using this Fanny pack for a whole month. I like the shape and the size of this Fanny pack. The only issue that i have is the Zipper position. Every single time, when I unzip, everything falls down. I would have loved it if it was on the top of the Fanny pack than at the front.
review.name: Fanny Pack Main Flaw

review.reviewBody:
I like the bataan 3L for is simple functionality and unique color patterns. Its deep single pocket has 2 zippers so it makes it nice to wear cross sling on either shoulder and open from top to bottom to help not spill things out accidentally. 

I wish the internal sleeves had zippers or velcro to keep small items from rattling around helping maintain some organization.

I also wish the belt buckle was wider but that's strictly out of preference. 

I like best to show my Filipino support with the packs display of the sun stars. My biggest motivation to purchasing this pack aside from the sale price.
review.name: Simple and functional design

review.reviewBody: This bag is awesome to have on an adventure as a secondary bag thats easy and packable but you may need a smaller bag for shorter adventures! Love the quality and the message the brand speaks on when making the sustainable gear thats fun and functional that will last. Hint hint hint great gift idea for anyone looking!
review.name: Great to take on your next adventure

review.reviewBody: This little pack is great, I like the way it opens so it's more hands free so I can help my kids with what they need. Also roomier than I thought it would be.
review.name: Del Dai fanny pack

review.reviewBody: This is my 2nd Bataan. The size is perfect. The colors are outstanding. So excited about my new one. The old one being passed down to keep the pups stuff all in one spot. Win win!
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: If youre looking for a side sling or fanny pack to carry your essentials, this is it! I use this as a side sling and love the functionality of it- has inner pockets but is unconstructed so it has room for your necessities and is surprisingly spacious.
review.name: Perfect size!

name: Bataan Del Dia 3L Fanny Pack

hasVariant.description: Buy the PEARL iZUMi X-ALP Canyon Cycling Shoe - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: True to size.Nice product
review.name: Good Value

review.reviewBody:
The fit, comfort, weight, etc. with this shoe is great.  Looks good, feels good.  The only complaint, which is somewhat of a big deal, is that the top mesh stretches when your pulling the pedals up. 
This significantly reduces the amount of pulling power with a clipless pedal, and just feels odd.
review.name: Overall OK

review.reviewBody:
This shoe uses loops instead of shoelace eyelets which I personally don't like. This is my second pair, one the shoelace loops ripped on my first ride. The return and replace process with CompetitiveCyclist was quick and easy. The second pair is holding up better and it's been about 7 months now. 

It's a great lightweight trail shoe which has decent padding. He padding around the ankle is very light but the heel and toe area has decent padding.  I am impressed with the protection and coverage in toe box. 

The soles are stiff but not so stiff that it makes you walk like a duck.  Makes it easy for when you have to hike-a-bike. 

I currently use these shoes with a set of CrankBrothers Mallets and they work very well. Didn't need to shim them or anything.

I have used these shoes for downhill trails and park riding but it's really best suited for trail riding. 

It's a good looking shoe and don't regret my purchase though I wish they made a wide version but the fit, for me, is true to size.
review.name: Good lightweight  clipless shoe

name: X-ALP Canyon Cycling Shoe - Men's

description: Buy the Specialized Turbo Cotton Clincher Tire online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Turbo Cotton Clincher Tire
hasVariant.description: Buy the Specialized Turbo Cotton Clincher Tire online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Ive been riding on these tires for 3 years now and although the ride is great, I have had flat issues. I ride 100-125 miles per week and I can count on getting a flat (and sometimes two flats per ride) regularly. I am switching tires and considering making the investment for new wheels and going tubeless.
review.name: Too many flats

review.reviewBody:
1500 miles and still going. 1 flat. And I live in the NYC area, where the road are mostly terrible.

Oh yeah. Fantastic ride. Blows Conti's away.
review.name: Great Tire - No Problem

review.reviewBody:
Loved the look & feel of these tires so got 2 sets. Unfortunately the first set had flats 50% of the time after my first ride. 

IMPORTANT!- On the second set I noticed a small bubble on the sidewall of my rear tire close to the rim after 1-2 rides, maybe 50-80 miles total. Decided the tire was so new it had to be ok so headed out. Lucky for me I was only going ~20mph when there was an alarming BANG and the tire blew out, riding on the rim in 0.5 seconds. I cant imagine the results if this happened on one of our descents at 40- 50mph or in the middle of a corner. 

Its on me for riding on a tire with a bubble in the sidewall- that was stupid. BUT, Ive bought a lot of performance tires over the years and have never had a set fail me as early and often as these.
review.name: Durability a serious concern.

review.reviewBody: The feel of these is fantastic! If it werent for the amount of flats Ive gotten I would give them 5 stars. The probability of getting a flat on any ride over 50 miles with these is 1 for me. Eventually I just decided to switch out the tires when the side wall got punctured pretty badly.
review.name: Nice ride, terrible flats

review.reviewBody: It is the best tyres I ever rode, run 24mm with my Enve 4.5 and Latex tube, it is just as comfortable as tubular tyres. They are simply fast, super fast. I usually don't run them in the winter or bad weather. I ride them for nice summer and in the race.
review.name: Fast and comfortable

review.reviewBody: I agree with the others. - these are great tires other than the constant flats.  Flats seem to be especially prevalent in the fall when the roads accumulate debris from trees.  Before switching to these tires I rarely got flats but now, I flat every other ride or so.  I'll be switching to something else.
review.name: Beware of Flats

name: Turbo Cotton Clincher Tire

review.reviewBody: True to size. Nice fit. Not too baggy. The drawstring is great to give a stylish look or avoid the bottom from being damaged.
review.name: Versatile and comfortable

review.reviewBody: These are a well built and versatile sweat pant. Love the new clip belt design and the lower leg lassos to keep the fit secure, it definitely feels like these could take some abuse while also looking stylish. I like that they are made from recycled materials too, always a plus. Enjoyed them so much I bought a second pair in black actually.
review.name: Rugged and warm, highly recommended!

review.reviewBody: I like the cinch cords. And the fabric is comfortable. The belt helps keep them up.
review.name: simple and sturdy

review.reviewBody: I really like these pant, kinda lime a hybrid sweatpants. Great for Basecamp, lounging around home, and maybe a cool day stroll. I wouldn't consider these hiking pants by any means, but great overall. I also like the draw string leg bottoms, I like to have an option of straitleg style and the ability to close them, get them above shoes or boots and seal in the heat.
review.name: Very nice sweatpant hybrid.

review.reviewBody: I recently purchased the Men's AXYS Sweatpants, and I have to say, they've quickly become my go-to pair for lounging and running errands. The fabric is incredibly soft and has just the right amount of stretch, making them super comfortable to wear all day. The fit is spot-on - not too baggy and not too tight, which gives a modern, sleek look. I also love the deep pockets that securely hold my phone and keys when I'm on the move. Whether I'm hitting the gym or just relaxing at home, these sweatpants are perfect for any occasion. Highly recommend!
review.name: Comfortable and Stylish - Perfect for Everyday Wear!

review.reviewBody: Wear them mostly around the house and for running errands. Really comfortable
review.name: I would definitely recommend these pants

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought these sweatpants mainly for hiking, but they are much longer than I expected. I really like the cord lock design at the cuffs, but they are still too long for me. I don't think they match the description of "ankle length." If they were shorter, they would be perfect, so I returned them.
review.name: Nice pants, but too long

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] North Face never fails, delivered quickly & comfortable gear!!!
review.name: Yes

name: Axys Sweatpant - Men's

description: Buy the Mammut Ducan Spine 50-60L Backpack - Women's online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Ducan Spine 50-60L Backpack - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mammut Ducan Spine 50-60L Backpack - Women's online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
The best part of this bag is the hip articulation on the spine of this bag. It is so comfortable and as an added bonus creates space on your back for airflow for less back sweat dripping into the crack. 
It did need some modification to fit my needs. I sewed a stretchy pocket on each side of the front zipper to carry easy to grab small items. I am not sure what the bungee that is threaded across it is supposed to do,because it doesn't cinch down easy, but I am not just using it to secure things in my new stretch pockets. 
The accessory zipper pouch that comes with it is basically useless and a waist of fabric, but the right hand hip bungee is nice and tight and was a new way to carry my poles that I was at first skeptical about. 
Overall very happy for backpacking.
review.name: The back articulation is amazing

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable, highly adjustable, every detail was thought through for ease, and convenience.
review.name: Its in the details.

review.reviewBody: I bought the Women's 50-60 for short backpacking trips. I have the smaller Ducan Spine for say hiking and love it. I thought I would equally love the Ducan Spine 50-60 for larger loads but it just doesn't have all the features I find would be nice to have for a backpack trip like an outer mesh pocket (rather than an outer zipper to access the main compartment. Also, as I was cranking hard to tighten the cords, I tore the grommet off the rubber piece near the top of the pack as well as the rubber itself (this was only my 4th trip using this pack) - thinking it should hold up to heavy tightening over long term use. I have pictures of it i could submit. I do love the way this pack carries on me, the roomy/stretchy side pockets hold a lot and are easy to reach while wearing the pack. Also love the material - if there were a mesh outer pocket and easier to use straps rather than the draw chords, it would be perfect!
review.name: I wish I could love this Pack!

name: Ducan Spine 50-60L Backpack - Women's

review.reviewBody:
Seemed like I got an older model or maybe something someone returned. It did not come with instructions and was missing ferrules and the adjuster barrel to adjust cable tension. This doesnt seem like a major thing but when you pay $70 for something so small its frustrating. 

Also, the adjuster barrel is critical because it joins the softer cable your router through the drop bar to the stiffer cable and is the only way to adjust tension in the dropper cable pull. Not sure what Ill do now.
review.name: Missing parts

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love all of the features on the Venu 3S. It has helped me train for a marathon and my performance  has improved because of its accurate fitness tracking.
review.name: Great for Fitness and Running

review.reviewBody: My husband bought me this because my Samsung wouldnt keep a charge anymore and I am in love with it.. I have the pink with gold ring and it has gone above my expectations!!
review.name: I love everything about it..

review.reviewBody: I've had this watch for about a month and am still exploring the features. The basics of fitness tracking are the most useful and easily accessed as planned. The numerous additional features are being learned of bit by bit. The depth of versatility will continue to be explored for some time.
review.name: Very versatile, long battery life

review.reviewBody: I really love this watch. The screen is bright and easy to navigate and the battery lasts forever.

review.reviewBody: Got the Venu 3S for Christmas. Even with the help from Garmins support team my watch still wont connect to a WiFi network. Im not sure if I will keep it or return it.
review.name: Venu 3S

review.reviewBody: This is a very sharp watch. Clean and sleek. Has more features than I'd ever need. I haven't even fully experienced it yet.
review.name: Very happy with venu 3s

review.reviewBody: I switched from an Apple Watch and I have been loving the Garmin difference so far. This watch feels so much lighter and looks great. The data it shows is great for sleep, body recovery and workouts.
review.name: Love the Venu 3S

review.reviewBody: I love all the features on my new watch, and it charges amazingly fast, so I'm never without it!
review.name: Great Watch!!!

review.reviewBody: Definitely an upgrade from my venue SQ with lots of extra features. Love that it has the ECG app built-in downloadable apps for extra workout plans. GPS is phenomenal. battery life is great. Just love everything about this watch so glad I switched. heart rate and calorie count steps. Everything is pretty accurate. Nothing beats a Garmin. brighter watch face with larger font is very helpful and also has a built-in flashlight app. there are so many great things about this watch cant list them all
review.name: exceptional features

name: Venu 3S

description: Buy the Rab Kinetic 2.0 Pant - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Kinetic 2.0 Pant - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Rab Kinetic 2.0 Pant - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
My original reason for buying this was for occasional use for when rain looks possible.

But living near and hiking on Dartmoor with its changeable and frequently wet weather I've ended up wearing these most times I hike during the cooler months.

Perfect for October to March but far too warm for the summer. 

I mostly wear just the pants and find them perfectly fine next to the skin. In close to zero or colder temperatures I wear Rab Power Stretch Pro Pants which are very warm. Or if cool but not freezing then a thin merino wool legging.

Above 14 degrees and sunny these are just too warm. 

They keep me dry in most conditions but not a replacement for an over trouser if its hammering down with rain.

Their biggest issue is the zipped fly - which badly leaks water if it's more than a short heavy shower. I wish they'd get rid of it, or I suppose I could buy the women's version but the fit would be off.

Nice soft material and doesn't rustle like an over trouser. In fact they are just as comfortable as a normal hiking trouser but much more waterproof.

I also have the matching Kinetic jacket which is also pretty amazing.

I've knocked off one star because:

1) The leaking fly
2) Very expensive!

Never the less well recommended if you live somewhere cool and wet.
review.name: Essential Item For Dartmoor

review.reviewBody:
I love Rab clothing and their jackets are fabulous. I have a down one and its still going strong after many years.
However, the RAB Pro Flex trousers are terrible! Theyre lovely for walking in but the waterproof quality is virtually zero in driving rain. Not particularly forceful driving rain either. They keep the rain out for 5 minutes at the most, then are just soaked through. I have non-waterproof trousers from another company that keep rain out longer than the RAB ones.
review.name: Rab Pro Flex trousers

review.reviewBody: Fantastic pants. Use mine when using my wheelchair, does exactly what they are meant to do. The fit is perfect for me, true to size. The quality of these pants are so good and look good and fill good on to.
review.name: Fantastic pants. Use mine when

review.reviewBody: These are incredible, in the past I had waterproof trousers that Id pull on over my normal trousers, if you know its going to rain you can just wear these from the off, really light and comfortable and a great cut.
review.name: Best waterproof pants Ive owned

review.reviewBody:
Always hated wearing overtrousers but walking in Scotland there is a lot of rain! I got these hoping I'd be able to wear them on their own as a waterproof option that was still breathable. 

So far they have done exactly that, had them on for a very wet trip up Nevis and for some hills in Kintail. Kept cool enough when it was dry and held of the water when it rained! 

Very pleased with how they have performed so far
review.name: Exactly what I needed

review.reviewBody: Great fit, very light and doesn't impede range of movement. A great summer mountain trouser.
review.name: Great fit, very light and

review.reviewBody: Bought a pair as I was very impressed with the Kinetic jacket. Wore the pants on a Bank Holiday weekend in Snowdonia. Saturday, Snowdon, breezy, pants warm and very breathable worn next to the skin. Sunday, Moel Siobod, persistent rain and strong breeze, pants warm, dry, very breathable. Lining is soft so pants can be worn next to the skin as well as over other pants. Very impressed by their performance.
review.name: Excellent product

review.reviewBody: Great light weight trouser for wet and windy days. I wear them with running leggings underneath. Brilliant combo
review.name: Great light weight trouser for

review.reviewBody: Incredibly well constructed. Nice and stretchy and perfectly breathable.
review.name: Incredibly well constructed. Nice and

review.reviewBody: The fit and quality is great. Personally I would have preferred a button fastening waist band like the Kinetic 1.0 I am replacing.
review.name: The fit and quality is

description: Buy the Lake CX332 Wide Cycling Shoe - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: CX332 Wide Cycling Shoe - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Lake CX332 Wide Cycling Shoe - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I measured my foot, added 5mm then went with the next size up and the fit was perfect. These are the most comfortable cycling shoes I've owned. Being leather they will only get more comfortable with time
review.name: Awesome shoes if you size correctly

review.reviewBody: Lake once took me to some of the best riding in my life, until last year. I received their top of the range, and, despite it feeling heavy next to my Specialized S-Works 7, it seemed passable. Then, April 2021, when the temperature went above 15 C, my feet started baking. At 20, I had to open them. Why? They have a synthetic black inner mesh layer that traps infrared and sweat. Unlike prev Lakes, a fraction of ventilation holes. In addition, that middle plastic support creases oddly, and, you guess it, does not wrap around the foot with movement. Contacted Lake and, although worn 500 kms, they agreed to a refund, and asked me to try two of their new prototypes. In those, they removed most of the leather, added hundreds of more holes, but their black arch mesh was a bad choice so I avoided. After this, continued riding with S Phyre 9 and S Works 7, and I was clearly 2 kms faster and cooler for the rest of the summer, 35-45 km/hr. Lake? Once good leather, now unimaginative, hot, poor materials and heavy and hot.
review.name: Horrible, hot and obsolete

review.reviewBody: I ordered 43.5 based on the sizing chart but they we about a half size small.   The width didn't feel much different from my Giro Techlace in the same size, but I am expecting some stretching over time.  The shoes look great and dual boa work very well.  There's not a much ventilation holes in the leather uppers - I suspect they could be hot during longer rides in the summer months.
review.name: Great Looking Shoe - Size up.

review.reviewBody: Despite having 3 other Lake shoes (CX403, CX241, MX238) that all fit consistently in size 50, I got the CX332 in and it seems like they are easily a size smaller that the others. I absolutely love the fit and finish, but unfortunately there's no bigger sizes for me. Going to try the CX238 or another pair of the CX241.
review.name: Definitely order up

name: CX332 Wide Cycling Shoe - Men's

description: Buy the Ooni Koda 16in Natural Gas Conversion Kit online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Koda 16in Natural Gas Conversion Kit
hasVariant.description: Buy the Ooni Koda 16in Natural Gas Conversion Kit online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I purchased this for my Koda 16. I followed instructions on line and installation was done in less than half hour. I did have to put a separate regulator on my gas pipe before the quick connector. If you dont a dedicated regulator, the flame gets too high and you will not have the ability to control the oven heat. Just follow all instructions and make sure there is a dedicated gas regulator on the gas line to the oven
review.name: Natural gas hook for Ooni Koda 16

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Tired of Propane tanks so I swapped out for Natural Gas. Was very easy to install and works fine.
review.name: Natural Gas Kit for 16 Ooni

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Natural gas conversion easy to install, directions were easy to follow. Works well for me.
review.name: Natural gas conversion easy to

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] First and foremost, this was NOT an easy switch to make. We did have to find a detailed installation video and purchase a specialized screwdriver tool (star-shaped). It took 2 of us to get it done, but we got it done and it's now hooked up to our outdoor gas line and we've got delicious pizzas.
review.name: A PROJECT but it worked

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The gas type conversion kit is easy to install and works perfectly.
review.name: Converted Propane to Natural Gas

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Just had over 20 folks to the house last night for a splendid pizza party (top off your own creation on parbaked shells). 

Knowing my natural gas on the deck allowed me to convert my 2 ovens so I didnt have any concerns about running low took the worry away. Yes2 Koda 16 ovensone reserved exclusively for my gluten free friends. It made the fun even more special.

Thanks guys and gals out there!
review.name: Takes the worry out of running out!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We recently underwent a backyard renovation and were selecting new appliances for an outdoor kitchen. The dealer was showing us all sorts of giant (and very expensive) pizza ovens and we just couldnt fathom ditching our sweet Kona 16. So when we found the conversion kit it was the perfect solution! Hoping that everything is finished in the next few weeks and well be back in the pizza business again!
review.name: Love my Ooni so much I want to make it permanent

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Would have liked o longer hose. Also my oven was different than the directions
review.name: Works well

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We had room near our BBQ to put the Pizza Oven, so I asked my plumber to install the conversion kit quick connect to our natural gas line. The kit comes with instructions on how to modify the oven from a propane line to a natural gas line. It took about a half hour to convert the oven and it definitely helps to have 2 people. It is easy to connect the oven to the gas line outside when we want to use it and we can disconnect and store in the pantry when not using. The oven fired up right away and we had so much fun as a family making our first few pizzas. We will be using all the time now !
review.name: Natural gas conversion kit

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Good instructions - easy to follow - minimal tools required. Results are fantastic. Thought there might be a loss of performance (heat) with NG, but the oven performs great.
review.name: Happy Converter

name: Koda 16in Natural Gas Conversion Kit

description: Buy the Osprey Packs Transporter Roll Top 28L Pack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Transporter Roll Top 28L Pack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Osprey Packs Transporter Roll Top 28L Pack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Transporter Roll Top 28L Pack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Osprey Packs Transporter Roll Top 28L Pack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Transporter Roll Top 28L Pack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Osprey Packs Transporter Roll Top 28L Pack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I use this bag for a short daily urban bike commute. The bag is almost perfect, but needs a few minor adjustments. Some Pros: This is much bigger than the stated 25L capacity. I am not sure if Osprey keeps regular tabs on that section of the web page, but I'm pretty confident in saying this is larger than 25L. The capacity is then increased further if you don't fully roll the roll top. Obviously you lose waterproofness, but I've used to haul bigger loads to work (there is a strap hook built in to secure your load too). The partially hidden water bottle pockets keeps everything very secure on my ride. Overall look and feel of the material is great. Hip and sternum strap work great and all zippers/buckles are high quality. The bag feels durable--hoping to prove that over time. A couple improvements could be made: the laptop compartment is not waterproofed like the rest of the bag. This feels like an oversight. I got caught in a huge deluge and unfortunately my laptop got quite wet. Need a daisy chain or some external lash point for additional items. My U-lock doesn't fit in the water bottle pockets as hoped, and the only lash point is at the shoulder strap. The bag appears to scuff easily. I don't mind, but if aesthetics is of concern to you, you may want to take note. It looks like osprey is moving to offer some zippered roll-top bags, which feels like a contradiction, but I think is a great move. On this bag the top of the roll top can be folded inside out to give easier access, but fully unfurled you have to reach your whole arm down into the bag.
review.name: Great features; OK water proofing; overall GOOD.

name: Transporter Roll Top 28L Pack

review.itemreviewed: Crossland Plus Mountain Bike Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: These shoes do not provide enough grip on the pedals for serious mountain biking. Also, on one of the first rides the upper snagged on a pin on my pedal and ripped all along the side - the material is very fragile. The fastening system is great though and they are comfortable. They could be an ok shoe if you are using them for road biking but they are not durable or performance oriented
review.name: Hard soles, thin uppers

review.itemreviewed: Crossland Plus Mountain Bike Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I got these for a flat pedal mountain bike to do trails and gravel.  They fit well and the soles are not torn up by the spikes on the pedals.  They are comfortable and the ratchet lace works well.  They have gone through dust and mud and cleaned up with a wet rag.  Nice shoes.
review.name: Nice flat pedal shoes at a good price

name: Crossland Plus Mountain Bike Shoe - Men's

description: Buy the MSR Alpine StowAway Pots online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Alpine StowAway Pots
hasVariant.description: Buy the MSR Alpine StowAway Pots online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I used these nearly every day for more than 6 years. I initially bought these for backpacking and general camping while I was going to school. They worked so well that I ended up using them for every day cooking in addition to any outdoor activity. Theyve been used over campfires, gas stoves, liquid fuel stoves, and even an electric range. I still have them and they work just as well as the day I bought them. I highly recommend these.
review.name: Used daily for over 6 years.

review.reviewBody: Absolutely fantastic. 775ml is about 3 cups and boils up enough water for ramen and freeze dried goods. I havent cooked any real meals in it yet, but Im sure itll come clean like my other MSR pots. The handle is good, I dont usually flame scorch my pots (hint they make steel wool for a reason). I dont understand the Uber ultralight need for titanium, youll get more mileage from the stainless. You cant go wrong buying one of these - do it, youll thank me and MSR.
review.name: Alpine Stowaway Pot 775ml

review.reviewBody:
Best camping and boating pots I have used in my lifetime. I have bought them for my kids and grand kids!
I found my first small pot at an old campsite and with heavy cleaning it is still in use today!
Thanks!!!
review.name: Best camping and boating pots

review.reviewBody:
Owning all 4 of them;
1600 Can store a complete kitchen inside.
1100 Is my favorite. It just fits the sides of a 10L Berghauss side pack.
775 Is a solid 1 person pot.
475 Never took it out. It spends its life at the windowsill.

Overall:
++ Wide base, good handle, secure lid, bombproof, usable on every heat source, usable with every food, dishwasher safe.
+ Reasonable non-stick if oiled correctly
+- None
- Some nesting polypropylene bowls would be a nice addition. A slightly wider and lower/sloped 2 liter version would be great, to better flip pancakes/eggs :)
-- None

Favorite stands for the 1100 and 1600 pots, with a Trangia B25, are:
A Trangia Triangle: Low profile. Full simmering control. Windproof. Light weight. 
A Firebox Nano: A nice wood & alcohol combi. Some simmer control. Light weight.
A Bushbox LF: The perfect wood & alcohol combi. It weighs more, but is enables grilling and bbq. And is a very stable platform.


Overall the pots weight, is more than worth it due to the functionally that they give.
review.name: Best pots there are

review.reviewBody: its very good and it will not tip over if you have it filled and try to pour out the contents. Also if you pour the fluids out at a faster speed it wont dribble over the sides. These were the 2 complaints I kept hearing about. I could see an improvement on the second issue with maybe an indent area on the edge where you can pour the contents and it wont dribble. One last thing that can easily be corrected is to have at least 2 volume markers on the pot. While your at it how about adding a canvas or nylon carrying bag for it.
review.name: its very good and it

review.reviewBody: I just recieved my 775ml sized stowaway pot and have to say it is built very nicely. The complaints I heard was it doesnt pour out cleanly and runs down the side. Thats true IF you pour slowly. If you pour it out a little faster it does not dribble. Second, the handle isnt sturdy especially when you pour out the contents the pot can collapse on the tilt. That is not true either. I filled it all the way up and with the locking tab slid close to the pot the handle held straight and the pot did not collapse over. I havent cooked anything yet to see if the handle gets too hot or if theres uneven heating so i will have to get back on this .But overall its compact size and stainless metal seems it will work excellent out in the field.
review.name: 775ml stowaway pot

review.reviewBody:
I have used the 1.6l pot for a little over a year now while camping in the uk; together with the pocket rocket. 

Ive found heat transfer across the bottom of the pot very poor, meaning unless you are only using this to boil water, you get a hotspot on the bottom that burns almost anything even at low stove temperatures. Pouring out is also tricky as the handle isnt stable.

The only use where Id say this would excel is for melting snow in the winter or only boiling water, not cooking.

It seems well made and the lid locking handle is a nice feature, but Ive found its not that versatile.
review.name: Its ok but

review.reviewBody: Good solid pots. Handles are a great feature, no more lost pot grippers. I would purchase again.

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love this pot design. Id just really like to see it in titanium. The latching lid is my favorite feature. Being able to latch the lid down not only enables it not to rattle around in my pack but I can also store leftovers inside of it. Just wish it was a fraction of the weight. Id love to see this classic design made in titanium.
review.name: Great Design but Heavy

review.reviewBody: Use for backpacking and home use. Great durable little pot but I always loose a great deal of water to the floor or counter.
review.name: Great pot unless you want to pour water

description: Buy the Mammut Taiss Light ML Jacket - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Taiss Light ML Jacket - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mammut Taiss Light ML Jacket - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Fits well for technical endeavors but the flatlock seam stitching on the wrist is unraveling on the second wear

The color and fit are great as is the function and design.

It breathes very well and the thumb loops are excellent but the stitching is poor. I cant recommend due to this. 

I am going to have to warranty or try to sew it myself which is unacceptable after only wearing twice.
review.name: Great product but poor stitching

review.reviewBody: Love the jacket, but don't love Mammut's recent change from printed tags to sewing rough, itchy tags in the neck line that are impossible to separate out without damaging the stitching of the jacket. Same is true for several t-shirts I bought. At least put the tags on the waist line of the jacket/shirt and not the neck!
review.name: Great but why itchy tags everywhere?!?

review.reviewBody: Great fit, sustainable, lightweight and versatile, this is the best layering piece I have owned.
review.name: Lightweight and warm, this jacket is my go to for everyday wear.

review.reviewBody: Lightweight and warm.  Fits well and comfortable.  Great for hiking.
I really like it. wear it a lot on temperate days or when I think I may need one because it packs small into a bag. I just wish it had hands pockets
This is a very comfortable jacket. It fits well and is lightweight.  Great for hiking or hanging out at the park.
review.name: Lightweight and Stylish

review.reviewBody: The jacket runs small, has no pockets and there are no returns. Do not recommend
Lightweight, athletic, slim fit, warm, breathable. Excellent for backcountry skiing.
review.name: Sometimes a hood is superfluous

review.reviewBody: I've owned a variety of mid layers from all the big name companies. This is by and far my favorite, it is warm and comfortable and most importantly regulates heat well. I was initially skeptical on the fit as the chest is proportionally small for the size but the stretchy material accommodates for that and makes for a flattering look. I am looking to buy more Mammut pieces as this one far exceeds my expectations.
review.name: Very versatile piece of technical wear.

review.reviewBody:
One of the best things about this jacket is the sleeve length. It does not come up short by the wrists, perfect for those of us with longer arms. Then with the thumb holes it works great with gloves, way less snow gets in. I have used this as a mid layer for snowboarding and I was able to wear a lighter jacket than normal. The fit is also spot on for sizing and I like the athletic cut of it. 

This jacket is also just a nice one to wear when out and about. It got a few compliments when I wore to work at ski resort.
review.name: Awesome Jacket

name: Taiss Light ML Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: Was looking for a lighter WM bag than my Bristlecone for an early June trip to Alaska.  I'm a side sleeper and a bigger guy so wanted something fairly roomy.  The Terralite specs seemed like they would work.  Just received the bag and am beyond thrilled.  Typical quality construction.  Climbed in for a 'test fit' and it's perfect.  Not too tight and easy to turn over in.  Thank you Backcountry and Western Mountaineering.  Will report back after the trip to see if it did the job.
review.name: WM Terralite

review.reviewBody: I just came off a cold week in southern Utah, lows in the the low 20's, and I was comfortable every night. I did wear a long-sleeve base layer but that was it, no socks and I was comfy all night. Best part is that a couple of nights in the 40's and I wasn't sweating. At 6' 1" , 200, wide shoulders, and a side sleeper the cut of the bag is perfect.  Not constricting at all.  For warm nights, the toe-box zips open for ventilation. A collar would be nice for colder nights, but that is the Alpinlite. Pricey, but worth every penny.
review.name: Perfect 3 season bag

review.reviewBody:
This is the greatest sleeping bag ever for someone that is 62 , 220lbs and a side sleeper. I have always struggled to find a WARM and LIGHT sleeping bag that would fit me and allow me to sleep on my side. 

The bag can be unzipped to make a quilt, which I used for an indoor cabin adventure. 

Do yourself a favor and buy this bag.
review.name: The best sleeping bagever

review.reviewBody:
I was needed a warm bag for a Utah bike tour. I narrowed it down to the Terralite and Alpinlite. I already owned the Tamarack bag but it was way too bulky for my bike. I consulted my ever-reliable Gearhead, Ryan, and he did not let me down. The big question I had was the Alpinlite had a down draft tube around the chest-neck to prevent heat loss as did my Tamarack. That feature is a big plus.

Ryan thought through the purchase with me. I already owned a 15* bag. The difference between the Alpinlite and Terralite is 5* and $90. The TerraLite would give me more versatility in warmer conditions. So, was that chest draft tube worth $90? Ryan suggested I could stuff a puffy in the bag that would serve the same function as a draft tube. I agreed. I'm carrying the puffy anyway, so I decided to go with the TerraLite.

I bought the 6'6' though I am 5'11" and am glad I did. The extra girth and foot length adds to the flexibility for temperature regulation and comfort (I want my tootsies to breathe).

The bag worked out perfectly. Though temps only dipped into the upper 30s/low 40s, I was toasty with my puffy stuffed on top. I plan to use the bag in October/November here in NE Oregon so that will test the bag's comfort.

Originally, I thought the Backcountry Gearhead program was a gimmick but after taking advantage of Ryan's experience and knowledge over the past two years, I fully appreciate him and encourage others to utilize this free valuable resource.

Bottom line: The TerraLite bag is a great bag and I highly recommend it!
review.name: Terralite

review.reviewBody: Most comfortable bag I've ever used. I bought this as a 3 season option for 20 and up degrees conditions, as its ability to completely open and act as a quilt is perfect and makes it usable in all summer.  I'm 6'2" so I bought the 6'6 bag. Even tho the majority of my height is from my legs, I can curl up with my lower legs perpendicular to the bag's length and have 2 inches of width to spare. All this dead space is hard to heat when the temps unexpectedly drop. The lack of a down collar or neck sinch makes it impossible to stop cold drafts without uncomfortably pulling the hood around your face and stuffing extra clothes around your neck. I love the bag, but I do not understand why WM opted out of a down collar, this would easily add 5 degrees to its lower comfort range.
review.name: The most comfortable bag I've ever used.

review.reviewBody: Returned because of Short hood w/o padding around pull-cord - otherwise a great bag.
review.name: TerraLite

review.reviewBody: Liked the bag initially. It?s not warm enough for 30F weather but it?s good for a spring camping trip (40/50s). Manufacture instructs you to wash the sleeping bags once purchased. I would highly recommend against this. I followed the directions exactly using down detergent in a tub, I washed it 5 times manually and dried it with clean tennis balls. Unfortunately I could not get the loft back to its original state and lost heat retention, now I have a $500 summer sleeping bag.. I tried to reach out to customer support multiple times for advice but got ignored. Do not recommend this brand.
review.name: Don?t Wash It!
comment: place in dryer on low heat with some tennis balls.  that seems to fluff mine back up again

review.reviewBody:
Great bag, great company. I've been using this bag for over 3 years and love it. It is a crucial piece of my UL setup.  

Comfort: A, The semi-rectangular shape makes a big difference (vs full mummy) in comfort for me; I can roll around and move my legs (as I am bound to wake up and shift a lot while sleeping out on trail). 

Durability: B+, I've had one little down leak that was repaired with a tiny piece of Scotch tape. 

Warmth: B+, I don't know about  25 degrees, as around freezing I'll be layering up or adding a down quilt, but I tend to run cold on every bag I've owned.  

UL performance: A, very light, packs down small, solid 3-season performance

*Tip: I just discovered that my Thermarest Neo X-therm fits perfectly inside the bag, while you sacrifice a little room and warmth, this essentially eliminates sliding (and cuts down the "crinkle" of the pad) and I have slept much better since
review.name: Oh Yeah!

name: TerraLite Sleeping Bag: 25F Down

description: Buy the 7mesh Industries Chilco Anorak Jacket - Women's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Chilco Anorak Jacket - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the 7mesh Industries Chilco Anorak Jacket - Women's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I love this anorak. I just rode the White Rim in a day and it was in the 30's when we started. I used this piece as a layer and it is awesome! It blocked the wind and cold while still keeping me warm. The kangaroo pocket is super stretchy, so as the day progressed I was able to stash my mitts and extra food and wrappers in it. I just wish the wrist fabric was something a bit softer- my nose got chapped because I was wiping my nose so much on it. It runs true to size- I am normally anywhere between a M -XL in tops and the L fits me well.
review.name: Great jacket!

name: Chilco Anorak Jacket - Women's
