review.reviewBody: Great fit and looks. The jacket is not as loose to the body as the photo shows. Rain protection is very good, although I haven't yet been on a long hike on a rainy day; more of 1 - 2 hour hikes, and the jacket has performed well
review.name: Good fit and functional jacket

review.reviewBody: Hood fits perfectly. Very comfortable for a raincoat. Is long enough to cover one's butt.
review.name: Fits well, comfy for a raincoat

review.reviewBody: Love this rain coat! I got drenched on a hike and the coat dried after the wind came up.  Super Light weight and great colors!  I was skeptical that it would keep me dry!  It did!!
review.name: Great waterproof raincoat.

review.reviewBody: This is a great, lightweight rain jacket!! The material is soft and not crunchy like other rain jackets. Its very comfortable and breathable and has nice details. It feels very high quality.
review.name: Great jacket!

review.reviewBody: I bought this a month ago, I still havent received it.
review.name: Package was not delivered

review.reviewBody: Ive searched for a while for a rain jacket that was actually waterproof as well as flattering, comfortable and lightweight.  This fits the bill!  The jacket comes just below the butt, is slightly fitted, is actually waterproof without being hot, and is packable.  Fits true to size for real women.   I really like this jacket.
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: Rain and wind proof jacket witch a nice soft feel. Quiet when hiking and hood fits well, but the sizing is a bit off. I think it runs a little smaller than stated, if you want to wear layers. I normally wear a medium, but had to go up a size for layering and now it feels baggy. Also, the white logo is a bit too obvious. Overall a good jacket.
review.name: A good functional jacket for windy, rainy conditions in the PNW or traveling.

review.reviewBody: Great quality and fit.  Can't go wrong with Mt Hardware products.
review.name: Great Fit

review.reviewBody: The arms are too tight. I do not see where this jacket stretches at all. I wish I would have bought the male version. I can zip it up, but if I have a couple of layers on which is needed in the Pacific Northwest it is not roomy enough to be comfortable. Otherwise wise I love the quality of this jacket & all my other Mountain Hardware Jackets.
review.name: The arms are too tight for layers

review.reviewBody: Soft fabric, but did not get a chance to try out its water repellency as I decided to return it after experiencing how difficult the zipper was to pull up. I could see that getting annoying very quickly, especially in the outdoor elements, so I returned it.
review.name: Mountain Hardwear Stretch Ozonic Jacket

name: Stretch Ozonic Jacket - Women's

description: Buy the Mystery Ranch Forager Mini 1.2L Hip Pack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Forager Mini 1.2L Hip Pack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mystery Ranch Forager Mini 1.2L Hip Pack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I've gone on a couple of trips with this and have used it as a day carry. It's the perfect size for the essentials to be out of your pockets and secured. On longer trips, I'll pack it in my larger bag to use on short outings. My favorite feature is the back snap back that faces the body. It's large enough for a passport and phone (Iphone SE at least) and keeps them easily accessible.
review.name: So Tiny yet so functional!

review.reviewBody: Haven't used it yet much, but just the right amount of space I was looking for. Have other mystery ranch gear and expect this will hold up as well as the others.
review.name: Just my size

name: Forager Mini 1.2L Hip Pack

review.reviewBody: I liked them so much I bought a second pair in a different color.
review.name: Fits like a glove.

review.reviewBody: These gloves are good, but the material is super thin. I will probably keep them as spare gloves.
review.name: Nice quality, paper thin material

review.reviewBody: These glove are great!! They are light weight and are super breathable!!! They fit like a glove!
review.name: Troy Lee 22 Air Gloves

review.reviewBody: Bought these a couple weeks ago and they are awesome. These gloves fit perfect and you can ride all day in comfort. In the woods or on the track these gloves are perfect.
review.name: Great product

review.reviewBody: These made it two rides and four of the fingers and one seem on the plan are blown out.
review.name: Two rides

review.reviewBody: Feel great and fit great but they tore on the 2nd ride.
review.name: Great fit and comfortability

review.reviewBody: I have 3 pairs of TLD gloves. These are my least favorite. They work well and breathe ok. I have the black color and they shed little black pieces of fabric all over my handlebars. I will not buy this model again, nor would I recommend.
review.name: They shed little black pieces :(

review.reviewBody:
The older style Air gloves were bombproof. 

These fail horribly.

Fit is great, but after 6 rides they have two split seems and are falling apart.  I have been a long time TLD gear wearer, but I will not be buying TLD gloves any more.
review.name: Not impressed

name: Air Glove - Men's

review.reviewBody: Just lives up to my three things: it's warm-would say perfect for cold but not frigid , comfort-fit me Lin a glove not scratchy.  Fairly lite weight given how warm it feel.
review.name: Headband

review.reviewBody:
Warm, soft, doesn't give you a headache.  It keeps the ears warm nicely, while letting your head breathe.  If you run hot, you will love it.  
If it was just a bit more windproof I would give it 5 stars.
review.name: A solid headband, keeps your ears warm

review.reviewBody: Great daypack for extended day hikes my fiance says it is very comfortable.
review.name: Super comfortable

review.reviewBody: It was the perfect size and weight pack for doing a Summer Accent of Mount St. Helens, got it for my wife and was light enough but sturdy enough to carry all her supplies including water, microspikes, and an ice axe.
review.name: Mount St. Helens Pack

review.reviewBody:
I purchased this pack in January to replace a different day pack. 

Great design except the little water hose clip, which broke upon my 10th or 11th time using the pack for hiking. Breast strap is now detached from the shoulder straps leaving less stability in my pack. 

Hiking pole straps arent really my favorite either but they work mostly. 

Im not used to poor quality with Gregory packs.
review.name: Breakable water hose clip/whistle
comment: Thanks for leaving your review.  We are sorry to hear about the sternum strap issue.  Please contact our customer service team so we can take next steps.

review.reviewBody: XS is perfect for a petite woman. Tried other cheaper packs but the straps were so wide they irritated my neck.
review.name: XS is perfect for a petite woman

review.reviewBody: I bought this for my wife. She has had other daypacks. This one is her favorite by far.
review.name: Comfortable pack with great features.

name: Jade 28L Backpack - Women's

review.reviewBody: I'm on my third pair of these boots (or close enough, have a pair of 120's). I've gone through plenty of boot fittings, tweaked boots that didn't fit great, etc. This is boot fits great. I have a wide toebox and calf, so need some room, but don't want to compromise being locked in (which is kind of impossible while maintaining all day comfort). I ski 5 days/wk, 50% off-piste, 50% on, with some multi-day tours thrown in. This boot does it all well, proper all-mountain functionality - one boot to rule them.
review.name: Can't stop, won't stop

review.reviewBody: Second pair of Salomon ski shoes, fit like a glove out of the box, pre-oven.  Tried several competing boots;  liked the Roxa R3's also (bit of a cult boot in some parts) but found the cabrio design and liner seam not for me with my high instep and arch.  Using mostly frontside (but I'd call this a great 50/50 boot) and wanted a one quiver boot.  Find a guru boot fitter, best advice I can give anyone.  Feet are like footprints; they're all different.
review.name: Best I've Had

review.reviewBody: I bought this boot about a month ago and been very happy with it. it performs great on and off piste and the walk mode is easy to use and great for hiking out to find un skied terrain or just around the resort.
review.name: Great boot

review.reviewBody: Love the walk mode option. Way better than my previous boots!
review.name: Advanced boots

review.reviewBody:
These boots were a bit uncomfortable with the factory liner. Also the walk ski function did not work. When I changed the liner to a intuition tour wrap the ski walk function was firing with out a hitch. I gained a ton more volume making the boot fit much better. Salomon needs to figure out their liner situation, or partner up with intuition to make this boot much better. Also, the new liner made the boot much lighter.
This is just my opinion.
I have a buddy who swears by the salomon liner and told me i'm nutz for changing it, but everyone's foot is a bit different.
review.name: Get intuition liners

review.reviewBody: I bought these a month ago and am disappointed in the walk/ski mode. When i flip the switch from walk mode to ski mode, it takes an incredible amount of effort to lock in the ski mode.
review.name: Hard to engage the ski mode
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

review.reviewBody:
Been using these for a good year now. My go to ski boots for shorter tours and days in the ski system when I might put on the skins to get further out and up for some secret stashes. Really happy with the fit and how well the flex is. 
For longer skitouring days they are a little to much, but for shorter days and laps they are really awesome.
review.name: Favorite freetouring boot

review.reviewBody: Excellent, strong boot for freeride touring as well as inbounds skiing. It's been used 50/50, love the boot, but would choose something else for longer days in the backcountry.
review.name: Superb Power

review.reviewBody:
I bought this boot last year and unlike most people I have yet to have a problem with the walk mode so count myself as lucky! Performance wise the boot is great, it gives me all the feedback I need combined with the stability I would expect for a 130 flex ski boot. 

For me the not so good is the fit. When I bought this boot last year I found that right out of the box and for the first 4 or 5 days of the season the boot fit excellent it felt like it wrapped around my forefoot well and I had no movement. After I had packed the liner out as most boots do at about day 5 I found that I had a significant amount of space and play in my forefoot. I have  a typical 100mm last foot so on paper this should be an excellent fit, unfortunately for me thats not the case. After further examination of the shell I found that the forefoot of the boot moves in a triangle shape; narrow to wide, which allows for a great amount of play when skiing aggressively. I skied the rest of the season in the boots - 55 days - and by the end of the season found myself putting a couple of fillers underneath each high-arch footbed in my boot just to get me higher up within the boots and take up some space. 

Unfortunately thats not all. Not only did I find the fit of the boot to be weird after some time in them but I found that edges chew up the plastic of the boots like nobodys business. Edges just rip shreds off the inner side of the boot and my pivots have left major indents in the heel. 

Overall the downhill performance of the boots are great but in my opinion the fit and durability leave much to be desired.
review.name: An okay boot. Thats it, just okay.
comment: Hello, we really appreciate you for taking the time to let your feeback on our products. We are sorry it didn't meet your expectations at all. We are working hard to improve our products and all these comments will go to our internal team. Thanks a lot!

review.reviewBody: I loved these boots as an all mountain option. However the sure walk mechanism is unreliable and broke after about 15 resort ski days. I need to keep my boots in ski mode all the time now because it can take a long time to get the boot from walk mode back into ski mode. Talking to expert boot fitters they noted that the internal walk mode construction is flawed. For the price point, I would pick something else
review.name: Great boot.. while it lasts
comment:
Hello! Thanks for your comment!

We are really sorry for your bad experience, we would like to suggest you to follow the advice of our customer service to be able to solve the issue!

name: Shift Pro 130 AT GW Boot - 2025

review.reviewBody:
Thin, slightly stretchy, breathable hardshell pants are great for ski touring, bridging the gap between softshells and burlier hardshell. 

These are well done, with a soft feel inside that you could wear against bare skin if needed.

As usual with Mammut the cut is great.

The fit, is not though. They are too short. I have several other pairs of Mammut pants in this size (32 long) and they fit perfectly, but these are too short.
The other thing is that the lower leg is way too wide. These are technical pants for ski touring, meaning you need to skin, hike and climb with cr sons in them. All those activities require a trim lower leg so you don't have swishing noise, or worse, catch a crampon and trip.
review.name: Thin, breathable hardshell pants are great for ski touring

name: Haldigrat Air HS Pant - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Captain Stripe Micro Crew Lightweight Cushion Sock - Men's
review.reviewBody: The Captain Stripe Micro Crew is lightweight with a lightly-cushioned sole and non-cushioned top of the foot through the lower calf. They were great for hotter days or more active pursuits, but afterwards got wet which left my feet cold. They didn't dry particularly well and I usually prefer a sock with more cushion. That being said, the lifetime guarantee is amazing and if you buy these you'll have a sock for life.
review.name: light, tough, and wet

review.reviewBody: Comfortable right away. No break-in period. Bigger and bulkier than I had hoped. I'll reserve these for dog walks.
review.name: Comfy, dorky

review.reviewBody: Nice and comfy toe box, very easy to put on and take off, also comfortable and surprisingly light and not bulky.
review.name: Convenience and comfort

review.reviewBody: These shoes exceeded my expectations when I received them in the mail. Most importantly, they're comfortable. They're warm, but not too heavy. Perfect for running errands or adventures in the pumpkin patch. I love the height, too. They're easy to slip on & off and look so cute with cropped pants. The olive green color goes great with lots of different color combos (jeans/blacks/browns). These will be a staple piece for me in the coming weeks as the colder weather sticks around.
review.name: Great Transition Shoe!

review.reviewBody: I haven't worn these yet so I can't comment on how warm they are, but they are very comfortable, slip on easily, and love the look
review.name: Comfortable and Stylish

review.reviewBody: I don't mind these boots but they feel more like a winter boot than a rainboot. They are quite heavy for a rainboot and they rub on your lower calf/upper ankle if they're not snug. I wish I would have went down a half size or worn thicker socks. You must wear taller socks so it doesn't rub on your skin. Overall, they are a great boot and it's almost like they have a dual purpose; rainboot and winter boot.
review.name: Keeps your feet warm and dry

These are a nice lightweight jogger. I ordered both a small and a medium, they seemed basically the same at the waist, the medium was a bit longer. 

The problem is these stretch out like crazy in the knees if you sit down. After an hour of lounging they look huge in the knees. I would not wear these out in public. review.reviewBody: I have a couple of the Lightweight Synchilla Snap Ts and procrastinated getting this heavier version.  Now that I have one, I realy like the extra weight and warmth.  I've even slept in it! If you don't plan on wearing much underneath, then you might want to consider going down one size; as they DO run on the large size.  I wear XL and even XXL in other Patagonia products; but find Large in this model and the Lightweight version to fit me just fine with, say, a Capilene long sleeve underneath.  A word of advice:  Choose your color carefully in this iconic Top, because you're going to have it and wear it for years to come!
review.name: Timeless Style That Lasts Forever

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Nice pack however its too small, way too small for a 16 laptop in a protective case. Also to small for more than a computer non cased and a college textbook. Lost receipt will sell at school. Son using his HS under armor backpack.  Good quality tho.
review.name: Nice pack however its too

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Excellent product love the updated zipper pulls (may need to replace another so I can have new pulls but of course the bag is in perfect shape otherwise) ;-)
We own many ospreys. Excellent quality very durable and full of great features. The best ever. Will buy again in the future.
review.name: Excellent product love the updated

review.reviewBody: Ive had plenty of backpacks the size before; however, this one seems effectively far smaller than others of comparable volume. So much so that its nearly useless for my day-to-day purposes; I bought it for work, intending to bring a water bottle, iPad, stethoscope, and a small lunchbox. Unfortunately, these few items barely fit in the backpack, primarily because of the weird configuration of the pockets, which prevent any larger items ( a lunchbox) from passing down further to the bottom of the main compartment. To get things in and out I pretty much have to empty out the entire backpack, then start over.
review.name: too small to be useful

review.reviewBody: first and foremost, i disagree with the first review. the radial does a better job at bridging the gap between daily commute, work/travel/school, hiking, and all of the above plus while cycling too. my biggest con about this bag is the 21 liter volume. take away the laptop pocket, the organization pocket, and eyeglasses pocket, and you're probably looking at more like 13 liter volume of space in the main pocket. my beach towel took up the whole entire space in the main pocket. make this pack a 30 liter and i think you got a winner.
review.name: almost there

review.reviewBody: Got it yesterday. This might be the first bag that sits comfortably at the intersection of work/everyday, travel and light hiking. Many bags from osprey and others can easily do two of those but struggle with a third. This has a well sized flat space for laptop tablet and a modest 3d space for rain jackets/layers etc. Also has the best number and placement of auxiliary pockets I've seen. Clearly everyday carry is the ideal fit for this bag but it should do well as a personal item due to size and upper pocket placement. The decent (though not luxurious) straps, suspended mesh back panel and size also make it a good though imperfect light hiker.
review.name: Might be the ""One""

name: Aoede Daypack

description: Buy the Sea To Summit Detour Stainless Steel Collapsible Mug online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Detour Stainless Steel Collapsible Mug
hasVariant.description: Buy the Sea To Summit Detour Stainless Steel Collapsible Mug online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I travel for work almost every week. With travel comes a lot a waste including single use coffee cups at hotels. This cup helps me reduce my overall physical footprint on this earth by eliminating the use of my numerous coffee cups. One step of many in my imperfect journey.
 It's collapsible feature doesn't take up space, it's lightweight, durable and easy to clean out! This is also a great coffee cup for hot brew by a campfire on any outdoor adventure you may have as well!
review.name: The Best Travel Cup

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This collapsible cup is a must have for any hiker or camper! It is super heavy duty and and keeps your beverage hot or cold for an extended period of time! It cleans up easy with zero leakage! I plan to purchase a few more for the rest of my family! This is definitely a must have for your pack!
review.name: Detour Collaspisble Mug is a must have for your pack!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Detour Stainless Steel  Collapsible Mug seems like it would be a durable camping mug. However I would definitely only recommend it for cold beverages. I tried coffee and the installation is easy too thin and about burnt my hands.
review.name: Cold beverages only

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Does not have to be used only for camping. This is perfect for anyone who has limited space, whether it be in your home or RV.. it folds to maybe an inch in width. It's easy to clean. The only con I have found with this mug is that the bottom gets really hot when you have freshly brewed coffee. But otherwise, I love it!
review.name: Useful & convenient!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This cup is super convenient for hiking! Packed this and my aeropress and was able to make an awesome cup of coffee. Folds down super small to make it portable and feels super high quality, especially with the stainless steel parts. Overall I'm very happy with these.
review.name: Great cup

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love this durable and collapsible mug/cup! I love the green color and the grip of the silicone part. Its easy to wash and it keeps my water cold. This is something I will have on me at all times.
review.name: Convenient and well made

name: Detour Stainless Steel Collapsible Mug

review.reviewBody: The pants are great. Good fit, lots of stretch. I highly recommend.
review.name: Great pair of pants

review.reviewBody: I used to skimp on hiking pants, spending more on my upper body layers. But then I tried the prAna Stretch Zion--which promptly spoiled plenty of other pants for me. The more relaxed fit and subtle stretch suits my sturdy hiker legs (and IPA belly) and leaves some room for my thighs to swell when I'm pushing up summits or pounding out 20-mile backpacking days. Now that prAna has brought back the original fit and fabric for fall 2023, I've picked up another pair since my first pair is finally starting to show a little wear and tear (not a lot) around the hems after 2+ years and 2000+ miles of four-season hiking.
review.name: I stopped skimping on hiking pants

review.reviewBody:
I bought these for my husband and he has yet to take them off. Practical for all occasions- camping (because they hide/wick dirt away), hiking, climbing, and grabbing beers. This pant is the best all in one pant for every activity. 

Kaley
review.name: Best gift Ive bought my husband

review.reviewBody: These have been my mainstay climbing pants for years now. Burly, comfortable, and they look good.
review.name: Favorite climbing pants.

review.reviewBody: I'm a big fan of these pants and where them to work, camping, and hiking. Very versatile and the fit is great.
review.name: Great everyday pants

review.reviewBody: Love the comfy stretch on these pants. Great fit.
review.name: Great pants!

review.reviewBody: These pants are great for all kinds of adventures- they're stretchy but very durable. I've been looking for something like this for a while!
review.name: Love these pants!

review.reviewBody: I have 3 pairs of these pants for hiking and they are absolutely perfect. They got me through backpacking through a snowy, rainy "summer" trip in Patagonia, countless hikes, and even work great for XC skiing. The price point is very reasonable, and I have recommended these to everyone from friends to my guide in Los Glaciares National Park in Argentina.
review.name: A must-have for hiking

review.reviewBody: I bought these for spring fishing in the southeast.  They are great for our cool mornings that end up really hot afternoons.  The ventilation and stretch are the biggest benefits Ive seen for moving around all day and not getting too hot.  Only one season with them so far so they are easily holding up to this point.
review.name: Very good fishing pants

review.reviewBody: Stoked that I found climbing pants in my actual dimensions (31/34). I was initially concerned by how loose these pants were below the knee, almost seemed like bell-bottoms out of the box but they slimmed up nicely after a single wash. Super comfortable, breathable, and stretchy.  I have only worn them climbing so far but they seem light and cool enough to wear for backpacking/hiking as well. As a climber in the south we have some wildly varying conditions and these pants are up for it all. I have worn these on a <40 degree multipitch day and an 80 degree bouldering day and they performed equally well for both. They are fitted enough through the waist and thighs to be super comfortable in a harness, and the shin snaps make rolling them up for boulders or sport climbs super easy and secure. Have only had them for a few months, but if they continue to hold up they may be my new go-to pants for any kind of climbing.
review.name: Great Climbing Pants

review.reviewBody: I had been looking for cords to wear this Winter for awhile. I have a short inseam (28") and these fit perfectly in length.  I live in CO so I don't want my pants dragging through the snow.  Super cute and comfy! I wear them almost everyday.
review.name: Super comfortable and cute!

review.reviewBody: I purchased these at full price, the colorblock pair stole my heart. I was aware of the short inseam. Myself, I am 5'2, so I figured they wouldnt be (too) short. They sit low on the hips which personally I like, the rear and hips are form fitting but they also fit more like low rise, vs the flattering tight high rise pant. The pockets in front sit a bit down on my thigh. When I sit down, they definitely ride up to mid calf, but everytime I wear them I receive a compliment. I find the very short crop but low rise form fit to be unique and oddly flattering. They have a subtle flare to the bottom which is cute with the shortness. If youre short like me I would say do it. But if youre long legged perhaps they may be a bit too cropped.
review.name: Selective Taste

review.reviewBody: These are great! They are so comfortable and warm. I would have given a five star rating, except the high waistband is really high. I have a short torso, so the pants go really high. I have rolled the waistband down and since there are no belt loops, the pants fit better and dont fall/slide down. They are the perfect length for a petite person. Love them.
review.name: Super comfy

review.reviewBody: These are literally 3/4 length pants..... I am 5'9" and ordered a size 2 and these pants hit me at mid shin. I do not have this problem with other pants from other brands so I was very disappointed as the description for the pants says they are full length. They are not.
review.name: 3/4 length???

review.reviewBody:
Was pleasantly surprised. Wasn't sure what to expect. 
These shoes are very comfy. That says a lot coming from a picky nurse who is on her feet all day for 12hrs at a time. Works wonderfully for high arch, wide feet, & high instep.
review.name: Expectations Exceeded
comment: Thanks for the great feedback Hannah!

review.reviewBody: This is my first pair of Merrell Sneakers, and besides it being a bit larger than my expectation, I am pleasantly impressed.
review.name: Pleasant surprise
comment: Thank you for the great feedback!

review.reviewBody: My favorite for years, just switched to the most rugged agility 5 and absolutely love them. I use them with custom insoles and they truly do take a beating usually lasting about 400 miles. Running in all weather about 40 mile a week on rocks roots snow mud and rain. They truly help me get my suffer on!
review.name: Rugged the way I like

review.reviewBody: I like them but the sole could be a little thicker. For better support
review.name: My first pair of Merrells

review.reviewBody: I bought these to wear at work, because someone else had told me how much she loves them.  I stand most all day and need comfortable shoes.   These are the best shoes I've ever worn for work.   They are so comfortable i continue wearing them after I get home and even on days I'm doing other things at home.   Love these shoes!
review.name: Love my Peak

review.reviewBody: Was having foot and knee pain. These helped relieve the pain
review.name: Love them!

review.reviewBody: I did not go anywhere but i use the shoes for work. I love how after 12 hour shift, my lfeet and legs are not hurting. I love all my Merrell!!! It is my go to shoes. Never need to break it in.
review.name: Comfort...

review.reviewBody: Great all around trail shoe. Holds up well on steep, rocky, and slick terrain.
review.name: Love!

review.reviewBody:
Love these, so comfortable, fit good!
I have a heel spur and these shoes have been awesome for healing it.
review.name: Love my merrells

review.reviewBody: These shoes are lightweight and provide excellent comfort and grip on the trails. My wife even completed a Spartan race in them, and they proved to be highly durable.
review.name: Lightweight - Comfortable - Grippy - Durable

review.reviewBody:
I bought a Patagonia R1 Hoodie in maybe 2017 and it was too warm, even with just one base layer and in 42F temps when pulling weighted packs uphill.  I ended up giving it away because I just never wore it. On a whim I bought this piece which seemed so lightweight that it maybe would not be useful, but I had to "trust the data" for warmth/weight compared to the R1, and was hoping it would fill the need I had envisioned for the R1.  Surprisingly this piece is my perfect midlayer in maybe 5-35F.  Depending on wind and exertion I will wear it on the outside with a super thin baselayer from 25-45F comfortably (low/no wind).  I can wear this only from the low 40s to maybe 60F.  When I wash it and hang it, it's dry shockingly fast, like 10-20 minutes. It's that piece that doesn't knock your socks off when you're trying to figure out your system, but it "just works" really well in a variety of situations.  

For quick drying, I want  things as tight as possible without being uncomfortable.  I'm 5' 9.5", 191 lbs, 43" chest, and I wear  Medium in this (very athletic fit, but functions really well).
review.name: Surprisingly versatile.  A steal on sale

review.reviewBody: Bought this as an additional base layer for an upcoming Kilimanjaro expedition. Have been wearing it in the northeast in some very cold temp and it is WARM.
review.name: Crazy warm!

review.reviewBody:
This is exactly the fleece I've been searching for in terms of weight/warmth and performance, but the fit is on the smaller size and could be improved in my opinion (more on that below).  

The pros: It's low weight, stretchy, and slim fitting with just the right amount of warmth to use as a mid layer for high output activities where you just need to stay warm enough while in motion on cold/cooler days (in my case, so far, it's worked well for hiking, snowshoeing, and winter fat biking, but not bouldering or climbing - more on why below). This is not a mid or heavy-weight stand-a-lone fleece that will keep you warm in cold temps, and that's not what it's designed for. It's meant to be used as a layer among other layers (e.g., worn over a lightweight wicking base layer along with a protective outer layer or shell, depending on conditions) or worn as a stand-alone fleece with a base layer in cool but not cold temps.  

The cons: The sizing, and specifically, the length, could be improved. For reference, I'm 6'2", 40" chest, 31 waist, 185lbs, with an above average torso length (25") and longer than average arms (33" sleeves work best), so not the typical dimensions found in most men's sizing conventions. According to the sizing chart, I should be a medium with room to spare but I'm glad I heeded the advice of other reviews and purchased the large, which fits well except for the length, which is too short for bouldering/climbing or any activity where you need to raise your arms above your head. When I raise my hands above my head, the fleece isn't quite long enough to keep my waist covered and raises up about 2 inches above my waistline. For me, this is only really an issue when bouldering or climbing, but something to be aware of if you're also in the longer than normal torso camp. After checking Rab's website, I found that the center back length for the size large is 28 inches (not the 32 inches listed on Backcountry's size chart) so that's my only issue with the sizing. If Rab increased the length to even 30 inches it would be a functional improvement making the fleece more versatile and more appealing to people that don't fit within typical sizing conventions.
review.name: Almost Perfect: Sizing Needs Improvement

review.reviewBody: I wear my Nexus probably 4+ times a week with a t-shirt, tech-t, wool base layer, you name it. It's incredibly warm for its weight and looks super sharp -- it is a snug, "athletic" fit, if you will. I most regularly climb outside in upper 30's - low 50's weather with it, but I've run in much colder temps with it, and used it for backcountry skiing as well. It is now one of my most-worn items of clothing and shows no signs of wear. Super impressed!!
review.name: Versatile and Surprisingly Warm

review.reviewBody: I took my Nexus on a trip to Moab this winter and it was the perfect light mid-layer for whatever I threw its way. Whether climbing, scrambling, or hiking it was breathable and comfortable. I felt no limitations to my range of movement and typically barely noticed it was there. In the mornings and nights, when temperatures were around 20 degrees) it went under a warmer jacket, but from late morning until the evening, temps from 40 to 60, it was really all I needed. The fit is slim, so if you're between sizes I would bump up a size. Highly recommend!
review.name: Light, Fast, and Warm!

review.reviewBody: I have used this midlayer multiple times right over my merino wool baselayers. It is a great option for a light layer that provides a decent amount of extra warmth but still allows the individual to really breath and work up a sweat in. The gridded insulation on the inside of this jacket provides excellent moisture management helping the baselayer wick away any surface moisture on the skin. On those cold days you would still want to add an additional layer of insulation over this before wearing a shell, but so far have really enjoyed this layer!
review.name: A Solid Backcountry Midlayer!

name: Nexus Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: High quality and well made.  This is the backpack if you need something that is simple, ultralight and waterproof.  It is a roll-top bag so not as convenient as one with a zipper opening which allows full access to the contents without pulling everything out but is is likel half the weight  The seams of the pack are the only areas where water could penetrate.  The 55l provides additional flexibility to expand when you have a larger loadout but can be rolled down to 40l if you don't need the extra space.
review.name: Great lightweight pack

review.reviewBody: I'm in love with this pack. The material is super durable. The build quality is amazing. I love the versatility of the roll top. There are two small things I don't like about it, which I wouldn't knock it for, as these things might work fine for some people. 1) The port for the hydration reservoir tube is slightly low and the pack is large so you need a really long tube. 2) The addition of one top stow pocket for quick access items like your keys or headlamp would have made it perfect. You can use the belt pouches but I would have liked one more pocket. Overall though, great pack. Super light and comfy.
review.name: Best Backpack I've ever Owned

review.reviewBody:
I'm in my 3rd season with the Southwest 3400 and am still stoked on it! I had been trending lighter in my setup for awhile but some low back issues prompted me to attack the Big 4 hard. I was a little concerned about the lack of padding in the shoulders and hips (I've had issues there before), but whether due to the overall decrease in my pack weight or just brilliance in engineering, I haven't had any problems. In fact, the overall fit and comfort of this pack surpasses all the other expensive, overkill packs I've had. I've adapted to the minimalist aspect of no internal pockets/organization. The external pockets are quality, and I don't mind the slight uptick in weight for their durability vs mesh alternatives. The 3400 is a great size. I haven't gone beyond a 4 day trip in it, but I have no doubt I could go much longer. On my typical 3-4 day solo outings, I don't have to lash anything to it and have extra space inside the roll-top. I keep my 5-section Z-lite on one side pocket with my Tenkara rod, my river/camp sandals and daily snacks/needs in the back pocket, my Be-Free filter fits into one hip pocket and my extras/phone (Sony xperia compact; probably won't fit much larger) in the other. I added a water bottle sleeve (from Zpacks) to the shoulder strap and now I have one side pocket for more goodies! 
I don't carry a daypack anymore because the SW can roll and strap down small enough (and its more comfortable than some cheap sack!) to make a summit run or daytrip with ease! 
Weather: Best test yet was a thunderstorm this year. I hit a couple cells without much coverage and no moisture got inside at all. It also rained that night (unexpectedly), and I awoke in the early AM with the SW in a small puddle in my vestibule; again, no moisture inside.
No regrets! Highly Recommend!
review.name: BOOYAH! SW 3400 For the Win!

review.name: Love the looks and the

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Perfect as a purse or to bring basic work stuff and a snack. An issue I noticed is the angle that the straps are sewn in are done so that you really can only carry it crossbody and not hanging over one shoulder. While I love the magnetic flap closure, it starts to mar the cloth and the outline becomes visible. Wish the inside or front zip had 1-2 organization pockets cuz everything just falls to the bottom of the bag.
review.name: Perfect as a purse or

review.reviewBody: The outside zippered compartment is actually roomy and the design makes it look sleek and not bulky when full. I'm able to store most of my essentials in the front zip and random bigger items like gym clothes in the center. The water bottle pocket could be a bit bigger around but not a deal breaker.
review.name: Love this bag.

review.reviewBody: I bought these chacos as a birthday gift for a friend, but I've had a pair of my own for 4 years, and have worn them on hikes, in the water on lake trips, every day of week long summer camps, and to day long amusement park trips and they have never once hurt my feet or caused any kind of blisters. I wear them almost every day in the summers and after 4 years haven't noticed any signs of wear.
review.name: I wear them to do anything
comment: Stellar! Thanks for the great feedback Andie!

review.reviewBody: No matter how much I adjusted the straps they were always too tight around my toe.
review.name: Too tight on toes
comment: Thanks for your feedback Ami. Most times you can fix the toe tightening by washing your sandals.  Wash on a gentle cycle in cold water with a mild detergent.  (Do not use fabric softener) Let them air dry.  If this does not work for your our ReChaco team can fix them for you, give them a shout at 888-211-9211 Ext 1 M-F 8am-5pm EST.  Hope this helps!

review.reviewBody: I didnt like the strap around my big toe on the Z2s.  I like Zs better.
review.name: Z 2s

review.reviewBody: My new chacos are fun colored, comfortable, and light-weight compared to my first pair. I have worn my first pair for over 10 years. It was time for new Chacos and I am not disappointed.
review.name: Love the new colors

review.reviewBody: I love my new Chaco's!   They are super comfortable.  I appreciate the rugged bottoms and the adjustable straps.  I like the toe loop design.  I do have a narrower foot - so I wish the "leftover" strap could somehow adjust so that it doesn't hang.
review.name: Great design - comfortable and supportive

review.reviewBody: Love these, as always. Finally bought a replacement for my first pair of chacos that I bought 12 years ago and wore all spring/summer/fall for many years and most of the summer for the past several years.
review.name: Classics.
comment: Thanks for being a long-time fan!

review.reviewBody: I bought this exact pair of chacos. I love the color and size was good BUT they do not have the cloud sole. That is what I was hoping for and it is the same old sole like my previous pairs of chacos.
review.name: Not exactly what I expected!

review.reviewBody: I would love to review the sandals I ordered, but they didn't fit and they didn't have a replacement.
review.name: Can't help

review.reviewBody: Comfortable, broke in quickly and look great. Have the version without the toe strap which I love and wanted to see the difference. This definitely feels more supportive.
review.name: Perfect!

review.reviewBody: I was so excited to get the but I couldnt even put them on. I even watched videos for some reason I could not get them on my feet and I have normal size feet size 7. It was frustrating so I thought if its gonna take that long to put on a pair of shoes theyre going back.
review.name: Hard to get on !

name: ZX/2 Cloud Sandal - Women's

description: Buy the MSR Windburner Duo Stove System online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Windburner Duo Stove System
hasVariant.description: Buy the MSR Windburner Duo Stove System online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I have a family of 5 and when we pack into the backcountry it takes quite a bit of water to do everyones mountain house beef stew at one time haha. Loved my jetboil but I bought this to upsize and because I liked the design it was a great purchase! Worked out incredible on our first trip to the backcountry and I cant wait for many more with it!
review.name: So far so great!

review.reviewBody:
Used on Aconcagua with 3 nights at 20k for a great Summit. Efficient and effective for boiling water from glacial run off. With only snow available above 20k, would have preferred an XGK. Went through gas very quickly at those temps and at altitude. Preformed very well for 3 overall. Would take again.

Packs up great, but ensure you pad stove and canister tightly in pot before transport on mules or airplane, titanium pot is naturally soft and will bend and scratch easily.

Low profile was great in the winds with confined space use.
review.name: Duo on Aconcagua

review.reviewBody: Boils fast, works well even in windy conditions, fuel efficient, nests together nicely.
review.name: Boils large amounts of water fast

review.reviewBody: This stove system does a terrific job. Its very well made boils super fast in all conditions and doesnt use much fuel in the process. Ya its a little on the heavy side so if youre wanting to go ultra light youll probably consider something else.
review.name: Works great

review.reviewBody: I really like the size and compact design. Great for camping, hiking, fishing, or hunting. Boils water fast to enjoy morning coffee.
review.name: I really like the size

review.reviewBody: Its a great product. Quality construction and ease of use. I feel like its to big for just a one person hunting trip. But it did the job it was intended to do. I would recommend this to anyone that needs a portable stove.
review.name: Its a great product. Quality

review.reviewBody: Base was very sturdy and folded up very compact. Boils water very fast compared to my 30 yo whisperlite.
review.name: Great Product

review.reviewBody:
Perfect size for 2 person climbing system or a luxurious sea kayaking setup for 1-2 people. Much more stable for bigger pots and use of the frying pan. Also nice to accommodate a larger fuel canister in the pot.

I regularly make Quesadillas and sautay veggies and sausage with this system or fit a few boil in the bags in the pot.
review.name: Perfect size for 2 person

review.reviewBody:
There's a lot to love about my Windburner Duo. It's incredibly fast and efficient, especially in the wind and it's a perfect size for two people. And unlike the personal, the stove sits on the ground so the pot doesn't sit nearly as tall. As a bonus, the stove fits perfectly inside the personal pot so you can buy that separately if you want a system which will cater to both the solo and group user. 
My main gripe has to do with the bowl. The bowl is useful but from time to time, it seems to get stuck on the bottom of the pot. When this happens, I'm forced to spend a few minutes fiddling around before it comes off. My other complaint is with the plastic lid in that its never able to pour water without dribbling down the side. I make sure to always seal the lid but I always lose around 1/10th of my water as it gets diverted to the ground.
review.name: Great stove but with some flaws.

review.reviewBody: Took this camping with a group. Water was boiled before other stoves were even done setting up. Impressive!
review.name: Boils in a blink of an eye

name: Windburner Duo Stove System

hasVariant.name: Aion 35L Duffel
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule Aion 35L Duffel online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Aion 35L Duffel
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule Aion 35L Duffel online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I had been wanting something for work that would be quick and simple for a couple night trip, that would hold my laptop, my PPE, and a couple days of clothes and out the door I go. But, while this states it holds a 15.6 laptop, my Dell for work did not fit, it was to tall front to back, was perfect width side to side, so I was a bit disappointed and had to return it.   Its made well, would have been perfect if my computer fit.
review.name: Nice Bag But.....

review.reviewBody: This is my first duffle in years. My travel now is 1-2 nights at a time and this bag is perfect. I actually really like the laptop sleeve in the bag. Quality of the bag is great as are most of the Thule products Ive used. Plenty of dividers and space in this for me.
review.name: Great duffle bag

review.reviewBody: The bag has tons of room in it and is built really sturdy. Easily accessible pockets, lap top pocket, dirty clothes divider etc. Great buy!
review.name: Built Well

review.reviewBody:
I have been using this duffle bag for my business trips for the last month and I'm on a plane at least once a week.  My main complaint regarding this bag is the division in the middle that is intended for the laptop/tablet/cellphone, keys, and cords; it takes too much space, and when you try to close the bag it's quite tricky. It gives the feeling that you could have added more stuff and it already fills full. Also, the pocket it has for water bottles because it does not have a grip inside, either put a big water bottle of at least 1liter or any size but with a full bag because if not, the bottle will keep falling. 

On the other side, things I liked, are those divisions help you divide dirty clothes from clean clothes or you can use one of those spaces to carry, documents or something else apart from your clothes, like an extra pair of shoes. The "nutria" color which I feel is olive green is amazing! It's truly water-resistant, I was recently on a trip to Chicago, we had snow and rain and all my stuff was dry! I also enjoy that "vintage" look it gets because of the material it is built. It gives the backpack character. It's really spacious, and it looks like it is way bigger than the carry-on, which tends to give a weird impression. Its a really spacious bag honestly, but would not recommend traveling with it at its full capacity, or at least I don't feel used to it when maneuvering with it. 
For me it's a solid 7/10. I will continue to use it and hopefully, I can get better use of it, or know how to better take advantage of it.
review.name: Its a BIG BAG

review.reviewBody: This bag is great, lots of compartments, storage, holds so much  Very well made and attractive accessory
review.name: Thule Aion

review.reviewBody: I shopped around a fair bit looking for a weekend bag that could stand up to some rough times in airports and on buses and trains, but still look classy. I think this is it! It holds a few changes of clothes, one pair of non-bulky shoes and some toiletries. The strap is comfortable and the bag seems very sturdy and well-made. I wish it came in another color, maybe a burgundy or tree green. But other than that, it's great!
review.name: Sturdy and well-made

review.reviewBody: The bag is great. Lot of compartments to keep stuff organized. But feels slightly overpriced.
review.name: Overall bag is good but slightly overpriced.

review.reviewBody:
stuffed this thing for a week long business trip to Europe. 
great design. Tons of thoughtful little elements  separate it from other duffles. 
I like the waxed canvas-like material. It scuffs but overtime it gives it accumulates wear and gets a used look that I appreciate.
review.name: weekender duffle

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Since I got this bag I haven't travelled with anything else. It is extremely well put together. I love the waxed canvas material, which holds up. well to any abuse. It's perfect for me for even a week away and has space for my two laptops and portable screen. It has a longer strap so doesn't have to be carried in your hand. Overall it is my go to bag and I love it!
review.name: Such a great duffel bag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this bag. It was very creative to come up with a bag that has the ability to keep my clean clothes off my dirty stuff. Not only is it a clothes bag but it doubles as a laptop or tablet bag too. You can even put the laptop on one side and your clothes or whatever on the other side. It's very well made and should last for a long time.
review.name: Great duffel bag

name: Aion 35L Duffel
